Review Text: Marusaka Hotel is such a gem in Nusa Dua. The rooms are spacious and beautifully designed, with a comfortable bed that guarantees a good night‚Äôs sleep. I loved having both a bathtub and a shower ‚Äî perfect for choosing between a long, lazy soak or a quick refreshing rinse. Another highlight is the private swimming pool shared by every 3‚Äì4 adjacent rooms, which makes it feel exclusive yet social at the same time. The hotel also has great dining options. The Bistro is perfect for casual bites, while the Gading Resto offers a more refined dining experience with delicious dishes. And just steps away, you‚Äôll find the private beach, a serene spot to relax, swim, or simply enjoy the view. Between the facilities, the comfort, and the location, staying here was a wonderful experience ‚Äî highly recommended for anyone visiting Nusa Dua.

I truly had the most perfect stay here at Merusaka, I‚Äôm sad I only booked 5 nights because I could‚Äôve stayed for so much longer. We had an all inclusive package which was so worth every cent. We had 4 spectacular restaurants to choose from with a mixture of western and indonesian cuisine. Breakfast had so much variety with such fresh foods. Lunch and dinner could be eaten at any of the restaurants which all had an awesome menu. Over 5 days we ate at every restaurant and couldn‚Äôt fault single thing. Service, outstanding. Food, fresh and absolutely delicious. Atmosphere, very clean, so well looked after. The rooms were no different‚Ä¶ absolutely spectacular rooms; modern, super clean, well maintained, 100/10 for the comfort and size of the beds (super king) and pillows. The bathroom very clean, well stocked with high quality products. Again, this was no surprise given the presentation of the resort. 3 pools to choose from, one that had a swim up bar and 2 diving boards was our favourite, it had music playing all day and had a great atmosphere. There was another 2 pools that was for the quieter people. All pools extremely well maintained. The hotel also backed onto the beach (no need to take the shuttle like other nusa dua resorts), which was lovely. We also booked a spa treatment on site, which again was so beautiful! I truly couldn‚Äôt fault a single thing about this resort. Every single detail was so perfect. I cannot wait until next year when I return!

Extremely disappointing stay, would not recommend! This was by far one of the most frustrating hotel experiences I have ever had. We reserved a king bed room for multiple nights, but upon arrival, the hotel attempted to provide two single beds pushed together and present it as a king bed. Even after raising this issue and changing rooms, the exact same problem occurred again. This is not acceptable and does not match the room type we booked. The first room was located at the end of a long corridor, next to a small, poorly maintained pool. The moment we entered, there was a strong chemical and renovation odor, making the room uninhabitable. We requested a room change and were required to wait a long time in the lobby before anything was arranged. The lobby and public areas were hot, humid, and lacked air conditioning, which made the extended waiting period extremely uncomfortable. Staff mentioned that someone would contact us via WhatsApp, but no communication ever came, even throughout the entire stay. The second room had a very heavy artificial fragrance, seemingly used to mask underlying issues. The smell was overpowering and caused significant nasal irritation and an allergic reaction the following morning. Once again, the bed setup was incorrect, with two single beds pushed together instead of a proper king bed. Although the hotel acknowledged that these issues were their responsibility, they still refused to offer a full refund. What followed was prolonged and exhausting communication involving hotel staff and booking agents, with inconsistent explanations and a lack of professionalism. Additionally, the resort layout feels more like an aging apartment complex rather than a luxury resort. Rooms are spread far from the lobby and require shuttle transport, which adds unnecessary inconvenience. Overall, the service, room quality, facilities, and management fell far below expectations for a hotel of this category. The property is poorly managed and does not deliver the experience it promises. If you care about comfort, health, and a smooth travel experience, I strongly suggest looking elsewhere.

An unforgettable stay at a truly luxurious and beautifully maintained hotel. We stayed in a villa, and the level of privacy is absolutely mind-blowing. Surrounded by greenery, with a spacious and spotless private pool and a scenic river-pool just behind the villas, it felt like our own little paradise. The food is fantastic, the beach is clean with plenty of sunbeds, and the resort‚Äôs three massive pools and extensive gardens still manage to feel intimate and peaceful. But what truly sets this place apart is the staff. They can accommodate any request and went above and beyond to help us organize my mother‚Äôs 70th birthday on the beach with private dining, a birthday cake, and amazing music. The duty manager and the entire team were exceptional. Highly recommend this hotel ‚Äî it‚Äôs perfect in every way.

A truly wonderful experience. We‚Äôve just had 5 very special days at this wonderful resort and it‚Äôs been magic. An older style resort, which I love‚Ä¶in beautiful, clean Nusa Dua. Rooms are lovely and cleaned daily with incredible care, lovely grounds and pools. Food exceptional and cocktails great. The thing I loved most was the team of people working there. Each and every one of them were friendly, helpful and always smiling. An absolute joy. I could not fault this establishment and I thank them for an incredible stay. We will return.

Hi, We stayed at Merusaka for a week, and it was an exceptional experience. The resort offers outstanding pools and excellent service throughout. We were warmly welcomed by Andre at the restaurant, and he truly made our stay memorable. He provided great food recommendations, arranged for our meals to be customised to our preferences, and even shared helpful travel suggestions. As a thoughtful gesture, he also gifted us a Merusaka coaster. His hospitality stood out, and he quickly became one of our favourite staff members. Highly recommended.

Lovely hotel, large and grand and visually stunning. It was full of people, and kids. But there were so many options for pools that it was possible to find a peaceful spot and have your own space. We had a lagoon access room and that was an amazing saving grace that we could retreat to if all else failed. Location is unreal, we‚Äôve stayed nearby before and love this strip for so many reasons. The views, the service, the walking paths, happy hours at all the beach hotel bars, and variety of restaurants . As well as a little ‚Äòmini Seminyak‚Äô treat about 3 minute drive away. Nearby massage spas will pick you up for free. What‚Äôs not to love?

We stayed here on our holiday and couldn't be happier. The staff, the facilities, the food, the entertainment, was everything we needed for a great holiday. It's close enough to some local spots like Bali Collection, Uluwatu, GWK Cultural Park. Ubud with the monkey forest, butterfly parks, etc, is a little further out but perfectly doable as a day trip. The staff were friendly and always eager to help. The food was incredible and generous, the drinks were fabulous. We had a ball at the foam party, the cultural dance night, we enjoyed quiet days by the pool. The inclusives like the spa treatments and photo shoot were additional bonuses that really made the trip. Highly recommend for families. My kids are teenagers, but young kids will also find things to do.

Our two-week stay at Merusaka Hotel in Nusa Dua was simply wonderful. The private pool attached to our room was absolutely fantastic and made the experience even more special. The hotel‚Äôs beachfront location and the many additional pools throughout the property offer endless opportunities for comfortable, relaxing downtime. The rooms, garden areas, and restaurants were all spotless ‚Äî everything truly sparkled with cleanliness. The staff were consistently kind, attentive, and always ready to help with a smile. We had an unforgettable time, and I can wholeheartedly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a relaxing, beautiful, and well-cared-for getaway.

My friend and I spent an unforgettable 7 days at MERUSAKA Nusa Dua, and we couldn't have made a better choice. The hotel is beautiful, modern, and kept spotlessly clean. ‚ÄãAccommodation: We stayed in a room with direct pool access (Pool Access), which I highly recommend to everyone‚Äîit is incredibly convenient. Although the buildings are situated quite close together, the layout is designed so cleverly that we enjoyed complete privacy and peace. ‚ÄãThe food was a highlight in itself‚Äîabsolutely fantastic. The buffet breakfasts were extensive, and for our other meals, we ordered √† la carte. Everything was always fresh, perfectly seasoned, and beautifully presented. I appreciated the selection of several themed restaurants, so we never got tired of the food throughout the week. ‚ÄãThe Nusa Dua location is great. Apart from the beautiful hotel beach, there are plenty of opportunities for exploring and walking in the area, which we took advantage of often. I must also highlight the staff‚Äîeveryone was constantly smiling, helpful, and made sure we felt completely pampered. ‚ÄãIf you are looking for a place to relax with perfect service, MERUSAKA is the right choice. We will definitely be back!

Can‚Äôt speak highly enough of our stay here. This is our second visit here and we have a 3rd trip booked for next May. Staff are amazing, we booked a room with ocean views which was outstanding. Food was lovely and plentiful. One thing about staying here on an all inclusive package is you‚Äôll never go hungry. The only down side was the hotels policy of allocated smoking areas wasn‚Äôt followed up. A fair few were smoking around the pool and left cigarette butts by the sunloungers. Not very nice to see or sit around as they weren‚Äôt cleaned up by staff. Apart from that our stay was just amazing! Can‚Äôt wait for May.

Just came back from a week stay with a group of friends and their families all celebrating turning 40 and had a wonderful time. We spent most of the time in the huge resort pool with our families. The well maintained beach was just a stone's throw and you had beautiful views of the beach from the pool. The buffet breakfast every morning was incredibly extensive with many cuisines, all of which were delicious. A special shout out to the staff at the kids club who were extremely attentive and warm. Great location, right next to Bali Collection for convenience with plenty of great restaurants within walking distance - Kekeb was a particular favourite! The free photography offered was a surprise added bonus. We got some amazing family photos taken along with some wonderful group photos too. Would highly recommend Merusaka!

We‚Äôve just done 5 days in a pool villa at Merusaka and it was exceptional. The staff were gorgeous. So kind, helpful and willing. The resort itself, whilst showing some minor signs of its age, was overall very clean and well maintained. And the facilities were spot on! And then there was the food which was EXCEPTIONAL! Honestly, we found so many items that we could have eaten a second time, but we wanted to try different things, which were then equally as good! 10 out of 10 all round. Would highly recommend for a fabulously relaxing holiday. And big thank you to Bhagas for his exceptional service and the two staff members who looked after my wife the night she was not feeling 100%. You made our break memorable one thanks to your kindness, professionalism and service excellence.

I am shocked by all the positive reviews. This hotel does by far not show or meet any standards of a luxury resort. As I would have to mention so many negatives - I only note the most important ones. The pool zone and breakfast area are a pure warzone - disgusting and ugly and do not ensure a calm vacation that you actually go for. In the breakfast area you may be able to eat 15% of served food without getting sick. The room air con is working but barely - and stinks horribly - that‚Äôs why they spray the rooms with perfume to try to hide the fact. I want to emphatise that I can understand that for many people - this level of quality and service is acceptable or even good. But if you truly already visited luxury resorts or mid class resorts in your life - you will be highly disappointed. Do not expect to be able to last more than 3 days here. I suggest booking only 2 nights and decide for yourself. For us - if going by money value- wed say the hotel would be fairly priced around 70$ usd for what it offers. You can get a lot better for 100-140$ at Westin, Nusa Dua Beach etc. Only bring your girlfriend here if she never actually been to a good resort - otherwise avoid.

Excellent hotel. Great location near the sandy beach. Nice pools. Staff is incredibly kind and professional. Fantastic breakfast. Suitable for families with kids. Most guests like to go to shops and restaurants in so called Bali collection, which we didn't like. There are good massage pearls, shops and restaurants in direction to a rather big Coco supermarket. Much more authentic and at lower prices.

A very nice hotel right by the beach at Nusa dua Bali. Big and comfortable room, nicely decorated on our arrival , with a nice welcome gift, which was a very kind gesture. Perfectly clean room with complimentary water every day. Very kind personnel always happy to help. Gardens perfectly maintained, restaurants, sun beds and beach in front of the hotel very clean. Exquisite breakfast options, you could have literaly whatever you wanted. It was our first time in a hotel that we did not have eggs or pastry for breakfast. We‚Äô ve tried as many local and Asian dishes as we could. Everyday different freshly made dishes. Different stations for ramen, noodles, Asian dishes, sweet treats, pastry, fruits ets. Honestly you could not ask for more! We wish we could have the opportunity to stay longer or visit the spa, but the group schedule was too tight and this was not possible. Despite this we really enjoyed our stay at Merusaka and I‚Äôve seen one of the best sunrise in my life! Thank you

This hotel has been built on a large parcel of land. Therefore, it feels very spacious. It has a lot of options in terms of food. The staff is very firendly and helpful. The resort also has easy access to the beach without 200-300 metres. The rooms were spacious and very clean. We thorughly enjoyed our stay there. Will surely recommend this to others as well.

I have stayed many times at Merusaka Nusa Dua, and it remains in my personal opinion my favourite hotel not only in Bali but in the entire world. Located on the most preserved and quiet part of the island with amazing sunrises, it is the only hotel in the Nusa Dua compound where you can swim all day long without worrying about the tides. It has an incredible beach including water sport activities, several swimming pools, a beautiful path along the sea to either run, walk or do biking. It is also the only one in the Nusa Dua compounds whose facilities (restaurants, bars and swimming pools) are facing the sea without obstructions. It has different types of bedrooms and villas to choose from so it can accommodate all type of clients‚Äô needs and tastes including the business-oriented clientele as they have ideal conference facilities and very qualified staff (please ask for Mr Made Yuliarta) to organise meetings and evening receptions. The many restaurants and bars offer tasteful food and beverages and if you want you can choose the option of the all-inclusive stay. But my favourite part of this hotel is the service. They really have an exceptional staff who not only is extremely friendly but above all so highly qualified. Throughout your stay, their main goal will be to constantly make you feel very special and answer all your requirements for you to have the most wonderful stay. A special thanks to Pitri, Yohana, Charline, Adi, Andre, Lidia, Sudarmini Fendik, Putu, Tedi, Trisna and Agung. If you want to have an ideal holiday in Bali, I recommend without hesitation making your booking at Merusaka Nusa Dua.

Super big luxury resort set within beautiful grounds close to the sea. The rooms were spotless and huge and the staff were warm and friendly. Nusa Dua being a tourist resort is not like the real Bali. The hotel is set within a huge gated complex that houses many big hotels. It could be anywhere in the World. Also not enough dogs on the beach. It is also a big shame that there is so much trash in the sea. Much is from the daily offerings (canang sari) lots of which have food items that are wrapped in plastic and also much from inconsiderate tourists. The hotel was great though and we are glad to experience a stay there.

Stayed for 4d 3n. The staff were great. Very accommodating, always happy to help. The room was spacious, though we felt like it needed a bit more lighting. Yes you could always open the curtains during daytime, but at night, a bit more light would be great. No remote for the air conditioning, so you need to get up from your bed if you want to adjust the temperature. Not sure if this is the case in all other rooms. Breakfast was good. Had variety, and some cuisines are changed day to day. Didn't get to try the other restaurants within the resort as we went to other restos in the area. Unfortunately, the beach was dirty. Trash along the shoreline, and on the water as well. So much so, that people walk a few meters away just to take a dip somewhere with less stuff floating in the water. I was really looking forward to go for a swim in the Indian Ocean, so this was a bit of a letdown. We settled for the pools instead, which were clean and big.

Stunning location but several major problems: 1. unreasonably strict restaurant hours and no warning about that. We went to dinner at 8 p.m and they didn‚Äôt even let us get a bottle of water. 2. very bad service that ruined our holiday! AND NOT A SINGLE EMPLOYE SPEAKS ENGLISH. At the very end of our stay we forgot a picture about 1 meter long on our bed and we asked the employees to check for it, showing also a picture of the object and its placement. We had photos documenting it, the picture was there and it was not taken before leaving and I don‚Äôt know if either they didn‚Äôt want to spend time checking (which by the way it‚Äôs part of theire job) or they ruined/took it by making the bed. We had to wait hours to have an answer, asking every minute. They lost it. But the very scandalous thing is that we had to spend over an hour trying to explain our issues, since no one of theire employees (even the ones who work in costumer service) spoke a word in English. I‚Äôm sorry but that‚Äôs not what i expected at all from a 5 stars resort.

Hotel yang nyaman,luas dan bersih. Fasilitas hotel lengkap,gym kolam renang,spa dan view pantai yg indah. Sarapannya enak dan banyak pilihan. Pelayanan dan staf yg sangat ramah. Cocok untuk liburan keluarga. Terimakasih untuk kue ulang tahunnya 12/12üôè Sukses selalu merusaka nusa 2.

Amazing service. The staff were friendly and attentive, even during the crowded breakfast buffet. They were quick, responsive, and well organized. Every staff member clearly knew their role and worked with purpose. It was impressive to watch how smoothly they handled everything.

This place left me‚Ä¶ honestly kinda speechless. The hotel grounds, facilities, and greenery are great ‚Äî no complaints there. But the rooms? Oof. Way too old and tired. My first night, the shower was broken: I couldn‚Äôt adjust the temperature and the water pressure was basically a drizzle. I had to run in and out of the bathroom trying to fix it, slipped, and almost smashed my head. The bathroom floor is ridiculously slippery ‚Äî barefoot feels like playing ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt Die Challenge.‚Äù And there‚Äôs zero warning signs. Also, there‚Äôs no power outlet by the bed. I literally had to unplug the lamp to charge my phone. üòÇ They moved me to a second room ‚Äî the shower finally worked, but then the sink drain didn‚Äôt. And the room had this‚Ä¶ smell. I stayed four days, the smell stayed four days. Housekeeping is meh. Breakfast looks huge with tons of choices, but honestly, not much actually tastes good. To be fair: location is solid, staff are lovely, and the pool area is pretty nice. But for a personal trip? Or if you care about room quality? I wouldn‚Äôt stay here.

We stayed here for 4 nights on our honeymoon. From the moment we checked in we felt like ghosts at the hotel. Not one person said happy honeymoon, tried to give us any sort of upgrade, and stuck us in the VERY back of the hotel with the longest walk possible. The hotel buildings are deteriorating and the overall hotel is max 3-star at best. Food at the hotel restaurant was not good, expensive, and super disappointing. Our driver mentioned that Nusa Dua area is known for super high class hotels which made our stay even more frustrating. Our clothes smelled like mold from the room. Beware of any outdoor space, including the beach and pool areas for heavy smokers making the place reek and killing the fresh air. Would NOT recommend.

Overpriced, Outdated, and Utterly Underwhelming: A Warning to Luxury Seekers ‚ÄãFrom the moment we arrived, this resort announced itself as dated and in desperate need of attention. What was presented as an exclusive, romantic escape felt instantly compromised. The open-air check-in was a precursor to the disappointing service and facilities that followed. ‚ÄãDespite booking one of the property's premium villas (at over $8.8 million IDR per night), the treatment we received was no different than that for a standard room. We arrived just one hour before the official check-in time and were flat-out refused access to our all-inclusive benefits. This is baffling and unacceptable, especially considering the rate and the fact that we were leaving early (8 am departure) and have access to a 3 pm late check-out. The lack of goodwill for a high-paying guest sets a terrible precedent. ‚ÄãThe Villa: Tiny, Tired, and Totally Misrepresented ‚ÄãThe luxury villa itself was a colossal disappointment. It was tired, and clearly in need of a renovation. For a resort charging this much, having no indoor seated area with air conditioning is simply a failure. The open-air only bathroom was yet another sign of the room‚Äôs age and poor upkeep. The amenities were equally insulting: the fridge was warm, and the all-inclusive promise amounted to just four included drinks per day in room with zero room service options. ‚ÄãThe All-Inclusive Scam ‚ÄãThe most egregious offense, however, lies in the all-inclusive package. We usually stay at Melia‚Äîwhich, at the same price point, is in a different universe of luxury‚Äîand this resort doesn't even come close to comparison. Upon arrival, we were told by reception that the all-inclusive covers only local spirits and alcohol. We quickly discovered this doesn't even include Bintang, the local beer of choice, which is an additional charge. Imagine the incredulity of being in Bali, on an all-inclusive plan, and having to pay extra for a Bintang! ‚ÄãTo anyone seeking a genuine, romantic luxury escape in Bali, I offer this sincere advice: give this resort a wide berth. It is totally oversold, severely underwhelming, and a misuse of money in such an amazing location.

The Hotel was outstanding overall. All the staff were friendly, courteous and helpful with all enquires handled promptly. The Hotel facilities were top class from the pools and beach to the restaurants and spa. The hotel property itself was peaceful and expansive. The room was clean, neat and comfortable with excellent air conditioning. We especially enjoyed the breakfast buffet each morning as we were spoilt for choice. Bali collection is nearby and accessible via a short walk or free hotel transport to and from the site. We had a wonderful stay and look forward to returning in the future.

We stayed at this resort for our honeymoon recently and overall, it‚Äôs a beautiful and relaxing place. The villa design blends luxury with nature, and the service team was very welcoming. Breakfast was also delicious with a good variety of options. However, as Muslims, we had a very uncomfortable experience. The bathroom is partially open to nature (as shown in the photo), which initially seemed charming. But unfortunately, while I was showering, a maintenance staff member saw me from above twice. This was extremely upsetting and made us feel that the villa lacks essential privacy. The hotel staff did apologize, and we appreciate their response, but this issue should be taken more seriously, especially for guests who value privacy for cultural or religious reasons. If you‚Äôre considering this hotel, I‚Äôd recommend double-checking the villa layout for privacy concerns. A beautiful place,but unfortunately, not private enough for us.

My Now Husband and I were Lucky enough to stay at Merusaka for 5 days, Fifth Day we got married at this amazing venue. Made the Events Manager was amazing, when I had a querie or concern it was attended to immediately. Food selected for our Reception was Amazing and was the talk of our guests. We had a Pool Access Room which was Lovely unfortunately it had an unpleasant smell first day which the staff quickly rectified. Breakfast which was included had a wide variety to choice from.

I stayed 4 nights in this stunning resort in Nusa Dua. The reception itself is a wonderful wooden building, open on 3 sides, allowing a view on the surroundings. There are 4 restaurants, a big swimming pool, a private beach with sunbeds and sun umbrellas, a gym, a spa and even a wedding chapel: you could easily spend your entire day here without getting bored. The room was simple but nice and very spacious: the only negative point was that sometimes a bad smell came from the bathroom. The staff was super friendly and very helpful. Overall a great place to stay in Bali.

05.11.25 * Kamar deluxe nya oke luas banget * Bingung juga kenapa yg bathub ga keluar air panasnya * Jalan memutar akses ke kamar itu yg bikin males. Harus nunggu/ pesen semacam golfkart (buggy nyebutnya) gitu ga efektif * Pdhl klo mau bs buka jalan akses dr depan ballroom ke kamar, eh malah ada jalan tembus dr luar hotel ke gedung¬≤ kamar * Ballroom nya kecil * Reception outdoor dan agak panas * Makanannya cukup enak (semoga aja halal ya) * AC, wifi, air panas oke * Jauh dari convenience store * Fasilitas lengkap * Private beach * Kolam renang berbagai macam kedalaman dan aesthetic

We had an amazing honeymoon here! The hotel is spotlessly clean, the food is amazing (we were in HB and tried the four restaurants) but the best thing here is the staff! Everyone from reception to housekeeping, F&B staff, SPA staff (if you come you need to try the Balinese massage). Well done Merusaka Team! We will recommend it and come back for sure üòä.

If you're looking for a hotel/resort that is awesome in terms of inclusiveness, great location, good services, plenty of restaurants to choose from, various facilities and great breakfast, Merusaka Nusa Dua should be in your go-to list! The rooms are all spacious and well maintained, the air conditioning is efficient and relatively quiet during operation, the facilities are well maintained with small exceptions, and whenever something occurred it was taken care of promptly and efficiently in a professional manner. The cleaning staff did a great job daily. The breakfast offered is rich in choices and very good in terms of quality, quantity and taste. The pools are pretty big, deep enough, and at a great location. Next to the hotel is a relatively quiet, semi-decent beach, and there's the Bali Collection at foot travel distance with shops and luxurious restaurants. The Nusa Dua city center is also very close. The personnel at the facilities was very friendly and always offered to help in any scenario. Most of the food we tried at the on-location restaurants was at the very least decent, with some of them being awesome :) The pricing is very good for the location and amenities and services on offer. Good job Merusaka staff!

Excellent service. Staff is courteous and prompt to respond! The rooms are ample but the bathroom could use a second sink. The beach and pools are amazing but do NOT test the undertow directly in front of the property. Go up or down the beach until you see YELLOW flags. Don't be THAT tourist because no one's coming for you without a jetski and one is NOT stationed in that area :(

Our first stop in Bali was here. It had a kermess with small shops where we could buy some local handicrafts. The staff was friendly and welcoming. The breakfast was decent, but the highlight of our visit was renting bikes and cycling through the hotels and groves. The only minor downside was a musty smell in our room, which we suspect was coming from the old AC equipment.
Stayed at the hotel for the first 3 days of our honeymoon. Everything was perfect! The premises, the food the hospitality‚Ä¶ this place is a must if you visit Bali!

I had an amazing stay! Everything was perfect ‚Äî I stayed in a villa with a private pool, and besides all the benefits of the villa itself, the hotel was exceptionally clean and well-organized. The restaurants were also excellent, offering great food and service. It was also close to the beach, and although there was quite a bit of debris and seaweed, there was at least one cleaning every day, which was much appreciated. Highly recommended!

This resort was a dream. It was the first time in a holiday where I actively wanted to stay in the vicinity for the entirety of my stay. The pools, location, beach were delightful and contributed to a beautiful holiday for my family, partner and I. Breakfast served an array of options: the service from the staff was outstanding, and everyone was attentive and friendly. What I enjoyed about breakfast was the fact that staff brought coffees and juice to your table which was really nice for a buffet scene. The food for lunch and dinner was also lovely, and the drinks were delicious. What I *wish* I had done was explore more of Nusa Dua and try some of the restaurants on the outskirts; it is only a five minute walk to a beautiful complex of markets and restaurants and the food was outstanding. However, it is just so gorgeous at the Merusaka that it is so hard to leave! *Warning* be mindful when doing your laundry here, it is extremely expensive in comparison to getting it done down the road. But there is accountability on my side for that too. My partner and I are really excited to come back to the Merusaka one day.

We just got back from a fantastic holiday. The resort itself is absolutely stunning, there are people cleaning and maintaining it every day. The pools are beautiful and there is something for everyone, if you just want to chill out or you want to have fun or enjoy a drink at the swim up bar. The rooms are lovely and clean, and well maintained every day. I loved having a lovely tub to treat myself to a nice long soak. The restaurants were great, something for everyone. The service was second to none, everyone was so sweet kind and helpful, they couldn't do enough for you. The Balinese are wonderful when it comes to customer service, they are so hard working, it puts Australia to shame. I would have no issue recommending the Merusaka to anyone looking for a fantastic holiday and personally will definitely be coming back.

2nd time in 6month, it was a wonderful stay the first time so we came again with our kids and brought my large family. Only negative was I spoke with hotel staff about being upgraded as I had brought my whole family 6 rooms and they didn‚Äôt even through in club benefits.

Excellent resort, fantastic service and wonderful staff. Can‚Äôt fault anything. However the floor of the room showers were slippery and we asked for a non slip mat which was promptly provided. Also only 1 pool had a hand rail making it extremely hard to get out of the pools. Very satisfied with food etc

This hotel is exceptional. It has a calm environment ideal for couples, the rooms are very spacious, breakfast is a combination of local and international cuisine and the staff is as friendly and attendant as every single Balinese we met. Overall, an excellent hotel with very good vibes.
Wonderful experience. The staff are amazing. Food and drink are excellent. Loved the room and the resort is conveniently located for shops and restaurants

Despite being the most expensive of the three hotels we stayed at during our trip to Bali, this large resort was our least favorite. The daily struggle to secure a lounge chair by the pool was frustrating, as guests would reserve them with towels early in the morning, and this issue was not addressed by the staff. This problem persisted throughout the day. Although the beach appeared attractive at first glance, the ocean was littered with debris. On our first day, our friend's daughter unfortunately stepped on a condom while walking on the sand. This incident deterred us from visiting the beach for the remainder of our stay. Additionally, we felt that there was an insufficient number of staff to adequately service the guests. Lunch plates and drink glasses were not regularly collected, and pool towels ran out on two of the five days we were there before being replenished. The resort featured four restaurants, but the menu choices were average and quite similar. Despite being on an all-inclusive plan, some dishes incurred additional surcharges. Given the hotel's location, we expected more entertainment options for guests beyond a couple of singers performing during dinner. After five nights, we were not only bored but also tired of the food. On our last night, three desserts on the menu at the restaurant below the main lobby were unavailable. Our room was pleasant, but it had only one hook for a towel, and the selection in the inclusive mini bar was quite ordinary. There was also no drawer in the room, which we found to be a design flaw. The sofa was uncomfortable as well. We paid extra for a room with direct pool access, but we only used it once and felt it was not worth the additional cost. On a positive note, the staff were friendly.

Great value for money and a top location in Nusa Dua. The beach is great and the resort offers loads of pool and beach options. Rooms are spacious, maybe a bit dated but still good. Beds are super comfy. Would definitely go there again!

We stayed in one of the Villas recently for 8 nights. The room was fantastic, very private and quiet. The staff were so helpful often going the extra mile to make sure our stay was incredible. The staff also enjoyed making conversation with us and suggesting locations/ attractions to visit.

Pros * The main pool was a beautiful temperature, and I enjoyed swimming whenever there was a break in the dive-bombing and cannonballs. * If you‚Äôre up early and choose your spot strategically, you *might* enjoy a peaceful poolside day ‚Äî though this was unpredictable and very much dependent on the guests that day. * We loved having direct beach access and enjoyed late afternoon walks along the sand. * Housekeeping were great and kindly returned a missing Kindle after our room change. The maintenance team were genuinely friendly, helping us open bottles when we could not find a corkscrew. Cons * The hotel has several pools (three main ones, two shallow ones, and a separate pool with diving boards), but none are adults only. A calm swim or quiet time is a challenge with children running, shouting, and dive bombing. It would be helpful if the staff contained the chaos to the pool that has diving boards. * There don‚Äôt seem to be enough sun loungers for the number of guests. We often saw people wandering around looking for a spot, and beds ‚Äúreserved‚Äù with towels but left empty for half a day. Staff didn‚Äôt appear to have a system in place to manage this, despite recent responses to reviews that they have implemented a process. * Breakfast was a free-for-all and felt like a survival game. It could be a science experiment on social and cultural anthropology. Barista coffee was a 20-minute wait, while the self-serve machines had long queues and frequently lacked cups or milk. Basics such as yoghurt were consistently unavailable. * Check-in took about 30 minutes, which wouldn‚Äôt have been an issue if there had been some kind of welcome or explanation ‚Äî instead, we just sat waiting in silence while the receptionist typed intensely. * I emailed twice before arrival, politely asking for a nice room within our booked category as we were celebrating a special occasion. What we received was not that - the room didn‚Äôt resemble the photos or expectations. After some persistence, we were moved to a far better one within our category, but it wasn‚Äôt the welcome we‚Äôd hoped for. * While Bali is known for its warmth and hospitality, many of the front-of-house staff (especially at reception and in the restaurant) seemed overwhelmed and gave the impression that guests were an inconvenience. * Do not go to the pool-side bathrooms. Turn around and walk back to your room. * Our ‚Äúking‚Äù bed was two singles pushed together. This was not a big deal for us, but worth noting if that‚Äôs something that would bother you. Simple Suggestions * Designate one pool as an adults only pool, or contain the shouting, running and dive-bombing. * Implement a policy to reset reserved sun-beds. There was no evidence this occurred, despite recent responses to reviews. * Consider extending the breakfast service hours or make use of the other restaurant spaces to alleviate the crush and relieve the staff. * Train front-of-house staff with a focus on personalised customer service and first impressions. * Clean the pool-side bathroom every hour. I am hoping for a response to my review. Suksma.
We had a wonderful stay here. Staff is very friendly and helpful. They have few restaurants serving great food. The resort pool and the beach opening to main beach is just amazing.

To Mr. Willy Thank you for the hospitality you provided to me and my family. I also want to thank Anita. But I'm sorry, I won't be joining Wyndham. I'm no longer thinking about the money I deposited with you. I'm deeply disappointed by the behavior of one of your employees. It deeply offended me and my family. Thank you for Your reply My review is for your staff at outlet Jajan By The Sea Merusaka

Lovely large room. Beautiful grounds, beach and pools. Service fantastic. Prices extremely reasonable by UK standards. On site restaurants have great service and food. Very difficult to find fault with it. Would certainly stay again.

Excellent accommodation with walking distance to Bali Collection. The rooms are clean & serviced throughly. The staff is attentive & excellent. Especially Sutin, our breakfast maitre d', she was super attentive and very well spoken. All the restaurants in the hotel serve great meals and all inclusive package have a lot of choices on offer. The sun lounges on the beach end is attended well, though can be a struggle to find a sun lounge if you don't get to the pool on time. Busy hotel but they have more than enough staff to service people. Not once we found anything out of place.

A great place to stay but it is vast and family oriented so expect lots of people. It is so big that nothing feels too crowded but you do have to be up early to get your place on the beach sunbeds! Lovely gardens. We had a room with a pool outside our balcony which was wonderfully tranquil. Plenty of restaurants and a short walk to many more nearby.

Very much enjoyed our stay as a group of 8. Hotel accommodates requests for interconnect and near to each other. A huge hotel, bit of walking to get up and out of the accommodation area. For us unfortunately the lack of food choices was dissapointing, not so much for breakfast but lunch and dinner. And lack lustre on some of the dishes we had. They could do with a bit more staff to ensure meals come out hot and quickly and efficiently. The hotel was very busy due to the holidays. Towels left on loungers could be enforced a bit more during these times.

Just spent 7 nights here with two teens. We upgraded to the pool access room. I really can‚Äôt fault the whole place. The food is good, service is great and the beach club with the jumping boards were hours of entertainment. We were all inclusive and it was excellent value. Very happy with the whole place.

Perfect relaxing resort, food and rooms were all excellent with second to none service. We had a Deluxe pool access room which we highly recommend. Every member of staff went above and beyond our expectations, thank you all. We were celebrating a birthday and wedding anniversary and received lovely cakes for both. We enjoyed a floating breakfast on our anniversary (extra charge - well worth the cost). Our air conditioning wasn‚Äôt working one night and was fixed within half an hour and we were offered another room until the problem was resolved. We will definitely return again without a doubt, can‚Äôt wait, see you next time Merusaka.

It‚Äôs the second time we visited this hotel and everything is good and clean! The also upgraded the gym and that was really important for us! The staff are very helpful and always there to help! The beach in front of the hotel is very nice also!

(If they allowed .5 stars I would mark service as 4.5) Had a lovely time at Merusaka, had an all inclusive package, lagoon pool attached to my room, everything was great at the resort and in the room. Would have been better if in room dining was included in the all inclusive option (I knew this going into my stay, just would have made the stay a little bit better especially after long days out). Had friends staying at the same time but arrived separately but were given more general information during their stay without needing to ask or extra information when asking a general question. i.e activities on offer at the resort during their stay, outside shuttle services, tour of their room and offerings available in the room. Was able to get the information second hand which was good but would recommend that this is given to all guests on arrival or when making enquires. Would recommend to everyone to stay here as you had inclusive options if needed, multiple different room options, close to markets and Bali Collection shops, near the beach, great restaurants, amazing different pool options around the resort and good up to date facilities. Just a note for possible guests there are a lot of stairs to get to the lobby/facilities/restaurants from your rooms so just a note if you need accessibility, there are ramps but some are steep. You could call for a buggy/golf cart ride if they are available but just so you are aware.

We had an enjoyable stay at the resort. My kids loved jumping in the big swimming pool. There are three swimming pools, each with lounge beds for people to relax by the water. However, the food served at the swimming pool could be improved.

would like to thank Mr. Ray, who was with us for the two-day city tour. I can‚Äôt really express how he felt like a great family member rather than a tour guide, and how comfortable he made us feel‚Äîespecially with our little ones.

I loved the package but we had a couple of issues. Firstly, we paid extra for a deluxe pool twin room. We couldn‚Äôt use the pool as the pool rail was very loose and would have come off. Secondly, my friend and I organised an extension when we arrived, as we were flying out at midnight. We stated over a dozen times that we wanted the package extended. We continued to repeat that we have the package so we will not be paying for anything. He confirmed and also gave a good deal as we were not having breakfast the next day. Our flight was cancelled due to volcano so we had to stay the night in any case. But our package was cancelled after lunch and when we complained they showed the paper that I had signed and the word ‚Äú‚Äúwithout‚Äù included package‚Äù looked like it had been added and was slightly different pen and looked like it had just been written. They wouldn‚Äôt do anything. They told us that as we had extended that we had the room until midday the following day in any case, so so much for the great deal the guy gave us. I did enjoy it apart from those hiccups, but there are a lot of very nice looking resorts nearby.

We really enjoyed our 9 days holiday at Merusaka Nusa Dua. Our room was very spacious and clean. The staff were amazing: genuinely friendly and always attentive. The breakfast buffet offered many different choices and the four restaurants were good. Lovely well-maintained garden. Nice pools. The beach is also nice and there is a paved path ideal for long walks or for jogging.

I forgot my keys and they made me and my wife wait half an hour in the humid and mosquito ridden outdoors before someone opened the door. There is no proper communication between the staff. I asked the guy at the gate to call the lobby so that someone can open the door when I am at my room but no one came. Then I called the lobby using phone number on Google, yet no one came, I called again, still no one came. I was walking to the lobby when a hotel staff on buggy said he came to pick me up, when I reached the lobby, my wife called me to say that someone came to open the door, so much confusion for such a silly thing. I wouldn‚Äôt consider staying here neither would I recommend it to anyone.

A lovely stay at this resort. Plenty of options for swimming several pools and seating available. The beach is close by and lots of seating available and eating and drinking services available beach and poolside. Towels readily available for your stay. Diving pool as well. Kids pools. Plenty of food options as well. Morning and night market stalls at the resort. Room service is great. Very clean.

We have had the boat Amazing week with you‚Ä¶ such a beautiful place and we have loved our all inclusive package! What we like best was the fact each restaurant served specific meals and it wasn‚Äôt all buffet style - this made it feel very good and 5*! The breakfast buffet was great- with the best omelettes freshly made! Lovely ramen freshly made too- and then amazing fruits and pastries as well as traditional Indonesian sweet and savoury foods- pool bar is the best! Right on the edge of the sea- huge waves in our bay, and lots of surfing! The sea sadly has pockets of rubbish which they try to clear but we then see more- not from the resort but all over- if you go out a bit you get away from it. The spa is very popular so we couldn‚Äôt get in, it looked lovely! The gym was great-my husband used it every day-various items to use including treadmills and weights! We were in Puri (palace) 1 with 3 rooms in the bottom with a shared pool! It was brilliant and actually having had private pools, it Was great to swim with our kids! The rooms were down a long walkway and at breakfast and in the evening lots of market trades were set up, providing a safe/non-confrontational way to barter for some local wares.they were always willing to knock the prices down - a sarong for 120,000 (¬£5) and bar clips for 30000 (¬£1:20) Lovely walk from the beach past Hyatt to the Water blow at the top of the beach- with a huge temple (25000) to get in per adult - about ¬£1! Well worth a walk and look! Felt very safe here it‚Äôs if security and staff very attentive! Look out for the squirrels! If you aren‚Äôt all inclusive restaurants serve you and you pay- or take the hotel shuttle to Bali Collection- lots of shops and restaurants‚Ä¶ even a small market out the back. We also did a silver class here-taxi took 10 mins to Nusa Dia silver class-¬£65 (1,300000) fir 2 hour class and you keep the ring you designed-excellent trip! We have loved Bali and would love to come back one day-lovely people/weather/food - a little bit of heaven

I have very mix feelings. This hotel is on prime location with a beautiful beach but that is all. It claims to be 5* hotel but as it is very old hotel it looks and feels more like 3*. The worst part is that it is really overpriced but somehow full in capacity and tourists. Our sleep was not good as there is almost no soundproof isolation as you can hear your neighbour walking, taking shower etc.

Omg, cannot fault this place. ALL staff were amazing. Concierge service was if only we existed. All inclusive food and drinks package did not meant watered down food choices or drink quality! The food was 5 star and the wait staff's efforts were as good as if we went to a local non prepaid 5 star restaurant. Cocktails included as many as you like! Spotless cleanliness and the private pool access room is a must if you come here as it was one of the highlights for us! Cannot fault Merusaka and walking along the Beach passing by many other 5 star resorts proved that Merusaka was by far the liveliest buzz and fun atmosphere! Was relaxing and unlike the commercial annoying vibe of well known less private parts of Bali that I've been told about. If I could post more stars I would!

In a nutshell, big sprawling hotel next to dirty litter strewn beach, tired rooms with patched up paintwork and scratched, chipped woodwork, noisy air con. Breakfast is a depressing food fight and restaurants have zero atmosphere. Bit like airport dining but more depressing. On plus side hotel staff are lovely but we were very glad to leave.

Stayed 3 nights and had a great experience at this hotel. Not only the staffs are friendly, they are so professional. Whatever time you need assistance they will likely assist you in a very good manner. As a mom with an under 1yo baby this helps a lot especially even after midnight calls they are so responsive and fast!! The view is beautiful so peaceful i enjoy everycorner of the hotel as well. Breakfast full of variety, always came back with a happy tummy, although i wish the baby chair could be cleaned cause everytime i asked for one it‚Äôs always dirty. I‚Äôd like to also highlight my favourite guy bli Anom at gading restaurant as he was the only one who offered my baby a freshly made puree. Very friendly, fun guy, even though we talked only once but the next day he remembered me and asked my family‚Äôs wellbeing again. Planning to go back here next year for a longer stay! :))
reat location! Excellent value for money. Spacious rooms, a good breakfast, and a beautiful beach. I often stay at this hotel when I want to reset and feel like a tourist again.
Great room with pool. Excellent bathroom and space. Service fantastic. Will come again. Plus surf out the front‚Ä¶.

We absolutely love this resort. Its our second time here and it's somewhere we will go year on year. The facilities, staff service and offers are top of class. Special shout out to Dana, Bogas and Beni from the paradise club and pool for making our stay so amazing. We will miss you guys, see you next year!!!!

The resort itself is beautiful and the service was generally very good. However, I had a disappointing experience that future guests should be aware of. Before leaving for sightseeing, I placed my watch and earbuds carefully next to each other in the room. When I returned, the earbuds were missing. I‚Äôm absolutely sure of how I left them. This experience has made me question how well the staff are trained when it comes to handling guests‚Äô belongings. I strongly advise future visitors to lock up all valuables, even if you're just stepping out for a short time. It‚Äôs unfortunate, because otherwise the stay was enjoyable.

I‚Äôm writing this with so much disappointment and worry. We took our son to the hotel‚Äôs pool party, thinking it would be a fun family day ‚Äî but it turned into a nightmare. While enjoying pool party he complained stings on his face . We took him out and after he showered we noticed my little boy‚Äôs face broke out in red, itchy rashes on his cheeks under and top of his eyes too . . He was crying and so uncomfortable, and as a parent, it‚Äôs heartbreaking to see your child in pain from something that should‚Äôve been safe. When I complained they told me it never happened before but pretty sure it may be wrongly diluted .Not happy have to cancel all the plans we made .

We had a fantastic stay at Merusaka Nusa Dua last week and were especially impressed by a few standout features. First: the pools! For the first time in years of visiting Bali around this time, we found a resort where the pools were actually warm. Both the large main pools and the smaller pool directly accessed from our room were warm - a very welcome change compared to the icy experiences we‚Äôve had at Sofitel and Mulia in previous years. The service across the resort was warm and genuinely friendly. A special thanks to Charline at Gading Restaurant - she was an absolute delight and made our mornings even more pleasant. As vegans, we often brace ourselves for limited or repetitive food options, but Merusaka went above and beyond. Management and staff made a real effort to accommodate us - inviting us to pre-order custom breakfast dishes, surprising us daily with vegan desserts, and even sending a beautifully wrapped vegan banana bread to our room for our birthdays. It made us feel truly seen and cared for. The buffet breakfast also had clear labelling and offered plenty of vegan options each day, which we really appreciated. Gading and Homaya restaurants had plenty of dishes that were either vegan by default or could be tweaked slightly to become vegan. We had the all-inclusive package, which was well worth it and made the experience feel even more relaxed. Highly recommend for anyone looking for a beautiful and genuinely welcoming stay - and a special shout-out to fellow vegans: Merusaka knows how to look after you!

Luxury hotel. Extremely spacious room with sofa and bathroom with bathtub apart from shower. Breakfast is overwhelming. From traditional English to Indonesian to Japanese to whatever your heart desires. The whole area is secluded and hosts a series of luxury hotels with security checks on entry and exit. Only drawback, due to heavy traffic, is that it is located moderately to quite far away from a lot of the places you will be visiting. A word to the management though: the staff at the beach should enforce the half our rule regarding the hogging of the sunbeds because there are quite a lot of people that regard themselves as clever and lay a towel and leave for a couple or more hours.

Resort yang sangat luas dan nyaman sekali, sangat terasa balinya... pantainya luas dan landai dan ada akses langsung ke pantainya.... Family pool sangat cocok untuk yang membawa anak-anak. resto sangat ramah dan perhatian pada tamu... Pertahankan service yang luar biasa ini... Sukses selalu ayodya resort bali,,, Nanti pasti Saya akan kembali kesini lagi....

Stay in merusaka for 3 days, upon checked in was confuse as the FO asked for ID of all members of family (abd took picture of it) complaint about it, and they said it‚Äôs hote Procedure. Never have in my entire experience checking in any all high profile hotel dis they ever ask for my spouse and children ID? Got my room, and found out that the bidet was danage and they have to replaced it. And the TV speaker was also damage, the sound was terrible (scratchy and all) For a Hotel with their price and location in Nusa Dua, i expected more. Probably will rethinking about staying there again.
We had all inclusive which was great value. Lots of menu variety. 5 pools to choose from, we liked the one closest to the beach. Staff were excellent. Facilities clean. Rooms large.

My wife and I couldn‚Äôt fault our trip. We went for the all inclusive food and drink package. We definitely got our moneys worth. The highlight was how friendly and professional all staff were. Stunning pools and had the best meals. Highly recommended.

Highly recommended. Beautiful view, comfortable rooms, good location and very nice staff. The only thing is the trash at the beach and in the ocean. Really hard to ignore it although hotel staff was cleaning it every day.

Having spent 2 weeks here for our honeymoon we can honestly say it is paradise. Staff couldn't be nicer. They all couldn't do enough to help you. We are already thinking of returning half way across the world to this amazing place.

Amazing resort with everything we needed. Staff are exceptionally friendly and helpful we were looked after so well. So many restaurants to choose from and plenty of sun beds spread across three pool areas and the beachfront.

Expansive property. Prepare for lot of walking. Golf cart shuttle available. But not sure how to take it. Breakfast buffet is expansive and can be very busy at times. AND THE POOLS!! There are multiple ones and different levels of infinity pools not too deep ones we visited and know of. And there are diving platforms available as well.
Great place to visit. Good food options. Entertainment. Lots of pools with different vibes. Nice clean beach. No hassles here.

This place is massive. Lovely beach front location and pools. Great staff at check in but some of the service staff needed additional training and knew little about the resort. Food was average and very disappointing. Room small and dark with small balcony. Shower flooded bathroom so needed yo have maintenance join us at 11:30pm to repair plumbing followed by cleaners to mopped up 2cm of water from floor. We felt like we were in a canteen at breakfast. So many people and so noisy. Nothing calm about the experience. Very disappointed overall. Won‚Äôt be returning.

It is not international known brand but we had very pleasant stay. The hotel is well maintained and managed effectively. Most of all, their service culture is really high standard and provided excellent services. We will book again when we are back to Nusa Dua. Thank you for memorable holiday!
+ kamar Luas, kamar bersih, cocok bersama keluarga. - pelayanan sangat buruk , jarang sekali melihat senyum, tidak ada interaktif dgn tamu, dan sangat terlihat membedakan tamu & tamu asing.

We loved it here, beautiful Beach was continually kept clean. The pools were amazing and the bar for the adult pool was incredible. The variety of food was really good and so was the entertainment. We had the most amazing massage here. We loved that we could walk to Bali Conexion for shopping as it only took us about 20 minutes.

We stayed 10 nights with a family of 9 in 3 rooms. The staff were so helpful, friendly and always courteous. Rooms were always clean and tidy. For this length of time, ordinarily we would completely unpacked instead of living out of a suitcase but as there were no drawers in the rooms so this could not be achieved. My wife is gluten free and the only restaurant that really didn‚Äôt cater for us was the Ja Jan bistro. We had the all inclusive, with 2 x 12 year olds and 1 x 13 year old having to pay as adults which I know is the same as most of the resorts which is so wrong. We ended up getting a late checkout as our flights didn‚Äôt leave till 11:30 pm. We had to pay for an extra 1/2 day which wasn‚Äôt a problem but our all inclusive cut off at 12:00 midday. We have been to a few other Nusa Dua resorts and we were always covered with all inclusive until we left. I understand this is Merusakas policy but a few hours of all inclusive is a way to get people taking about your resort as you don‚Äôt take not consideration the check in time people arrive as their all inclusive starts at 2:00 pm and you may not arrive till the evening. Your employees at the main pool and the all day dining restaurant were fantastic. More evening shows for all your guests, not just the special ones that you pay extra for, would be hi lights for people and that will also get people talking about your resort. Push bikes should be able to use without having to pay on an all inclusive package. Just a few suggestions. Al in all our family had a great time at your resort.

This has become one of our favourite hotel! The amazing staff, consistent service, and beautiful grounds made our experience so memorable. We stayed for 7 nights and loved every minute of it. Would highly recommend this hotel.

Pool bar music is pretty atrocious, not sure who chooses the playlist but they need to reconsider the choices; oh and the speaker (there‚Äôs only one) needs badly replacing. Overall service falls behind the rest of the Nusa Dua area as does the quality of the food and beverages; cocktails in particular. Pretty disappointing at best.

3/5 ‚Äì Mixed Experience, Room for Improvement We stayed for 4 days and 3 nights, booking two pool access rooms. Upon check-in, we discovered that only one room had a king-sized bed, while the other had two singles pushed together‚Äîapparently no other rooms were available. The receptionist seemed to be having a rough day and didn‚Äôt greet us warmly, though that‚Äôs understandable. Once in the room, the air conditioning wasn‚Äôt functioning properly and required two visits from maintenance. The mattress was clearly old and not comfortable, making sleep difficult. We also had to request for the pool to be cleaned, which was disappointing considering it was a pool access room. On a more positive note, room service was decent, the breakfast staff were excellent, and the restaurants on the property were truly impressive. The beach was beautiful and added a lot of value to our stay. With some attention to room maintenance and staff training at reception, this could be a much better experience.

We recently held our wedding at Merusaka Nusa Dua and it was absolutely perfect. The hotel itself is unbelievably clean, the food is amazing, and the facilities were everything we could have wanted. A special mention goes to the wedding organiser Gita, who went above and beyond to ensure everything ran smoothly on our special day ‚Äì nothing was too much trouble and his attention to detail made the whole experience stress-free. We are so grateful to the team at Merusaka for making our wedding truly unforgettable. Highly recommend!

Great location Super clean Helpful staff but almost too helpful at times, when you just want something simple. Close to Bali collection my and the strip. You can walk. Beach is beautiful but the water does still get trash but it is not their fault. Pools are great, all of them. Sun loungers people do put down and leave so you need to be early if you have specific ones in mind to use. Food at breakfast was good, with plenty of selection and was very good with my daughters allergies. The breakfast staff are amazing actually. Also the kids club staff. Great women. The kids wouldn‚Äôt leave and loved it. Kids club was so good for us and it‚Äôs close to the pool, with full glass windows and a camera. My girls loved the staff. Thank you so much to you. Doors are not sound proof. The rooms seems okay though. The shower and the wasn‚Äôt great. And the balcony we didn‚Äôt use, looked depressing. Super clean through out. I don‚Äôt like the form party around the pool bar with drunk adults, children and low visibility. Market stalls too with reasonable prices. I would stay again but for short breaks. It is a little boring with no entertainment programme. Even in the day they list it but apart from yoga you see nothing. Same with night time, beach front dining and nothing ‚Ä¶.

Great place for business and relax. The room is good, but the service is even better! Warm welcome from arrival to sincere farewell, while experience attentive staff to accommodate your deserved needs during your stay. Its a short yet great stay there.

Merusaka Bali boasts a stunning beachfront location with easy access to the shore, making it a wonderful spot for those looking to relax by the ocean. The staff was exceptionally friendly and helpful, always ready to assist with a warm smile. However, our stay was not without its drawbacks. The beds in our room were noticeably lumpy and sunken, making sleep less comfortable than expected. Mosquitoes in the room were a persistent nuisance throughout the night, and despite attempts to manage the issue, they detracted from the overall experience. Additionally, the drainage in both the shower and sink was frustratingly slow, leading to pooling water and an inconvenience during use. The welcome fruit basket, while a nice touch, was misnamed and the fruit not ripe. The breakfast buffet was underwhelming, with a limited variety and food quality that did not meet expectations. While the location and service shine, improvements in comfort and amenities would greatly enhance the guest experience. Our experience at this hotel led us to cancel our remaining nights and rebook at a nearby alternative hotel.

Great location. Resort was fully booked during stay but didn‚Äôt seem crowded. Nice staff and good service. Two weddings while we were there so be aware if you are bringing kids there may be noise until 10pm (upside - fireworks!)

My family had a wonderful time at Merusaka. Service exceeded our expectations. All staff, including the porters, receptionists, maintenance, and f&b were helpful, spoke with a smile, and their kindness shone through. When we complained abt our TV's missing audio, they replaced the whole TV with another. Rooms were well maintained. The in-room pool was clean and warm. The pools were enjoyable too. My only little complaint is the cleanliness of the beach. I feel the hotel could have done better to comb through the sand for litter and keep it pristine. Overall great stay! Thank you Merusaka!

The Merasuka was an absolute delight, the staff made us feel so welcomed and were a real highlight of our stay. We had the beautiful villa with a pool which was devine, could not recommend the resort more highly, we‚Äôll be back!

Honestly it‚Äôs probably 5 stars if you are into the resort type holiday and you have no dietary requirements. Otherwise I would not recommend. The facilities are good and clean and staff are lovely but that‚Äôs it. Pools and beach are overcrowded, or just the seats provided. People put their towels on them and they don‚Äôt come for 4-5 hours to sit on them but they just do it to save space. Annoying! Entitled guests are the main issue. There are zero vegan options on any menus of any of the restaurants in the resort. Very disappointing. Had to order food every time and get it delivered. They cater to general public but that‚Äôs it. The entire resort area is restricted access and you don‚Äôt even know you are in Bali. No culture exposure at all. Personally I was not a fan of that but if you are then it‚Äôs good.

We stayed at Merusaka Nusa Dua in a room with a private pool ‚Äî it was absolutely exceptional! The setting is beautiful, the hotel is well maintained, and the staff were all incredibly kind and cheerful, which made our stay even better. The only small downside was the bed ‚Äî it was very wide but not the most comfortable for us. Other than that, everything was perfect. Thank you to the whole team for an unforgettable stay!

Positive: The staff is very friendly and helpful, the service was excellent. The outside area of the hotel is nicely done and huge. Pools and beach are also nice to relax, but the sunbeds are often broken/dirty and won‚Äôt be repaired (see other reviews). Restaurants were good too. Negative: We had booked a Deluxe Room with Pool Access. The whole room needs to be renovated, especially the bathroom. The shower head was completely calcified, the water went basically everywhere but not where you want it. It made taking a shower uncomfortable. The rain shower didn‚Äôt work at all (and was also completely dirty). The light in the bathroom was poor and not bright enough. The room and its furnishing is old and you can see signs of wear everywhere. Do not expect luxury when booking this hotel, it is mass processing (especially during breakfast). I would rate this hotel max. a 4-star standard, for the price it costs I unfortunately can‚Äôt recommend it.

2nd time being here. Definitely not as good as I remember. Service is really slow. No one asks you for anything it‚Äôs all done by QR code. Really disappointing you pay to stay at a hotel and can‚Äôt even sit around the pool because all the seats are taken.

Excellent hotel, excellent experience. What a nice service all the day with delicious food, super clean rooms and hotel place. Also great location to Bali collection with plenty of shopping, food, theater options. Definitely will consider to come again!
We stayed here for 2 nights. Great experience. We love the location. The room is somspacious. We will come back.

My husband and l had our honeymoon dinner at Jan Bistro restaurant and l must express my awe for the hospitality, food rapsody alog with details carefully prepared. Our waiter, Mr Rediana was indeed professional, kind and welcoming, made our dinner pleasant and worth remembering. Way he presented the dishes, made us feel special and maintained balance between our private time and his engaging conversations was great.
The hotel is ok, big and right in front of the beach. Breakfast is tasteless! Super disappointed with the quality guys should invest a bit more!
HOTEL nya Bagus..dan beaar sekali. Cocok buat yg mau liburan di Pantai pasir putih nisa dua.. Reception nya Grand sekali.. Recommended

Our family of 5 had a great time at the Merusaka! 8 days and could not fault 1 thing. Location was great, service was amazing and the interconnecting rooms were great for our family holiday! Beds and pillows were so comfortable!!! The service provided by the staff, especially Dana & Bagas at the poolside bar. They constantly went above and beyond to ensure all guests were looked after and having a great time! All inclusive package is definitely the way to go! We will definitely be back!

We had a great stay and felt truly valued, especially during a birthday surprise with a complimentary cake and singing waiters at breakfast. Guest Relations was super friendly, and room decoration for just ‚Ç¨15 was a lovely extra. The hotel is in good shape overall, with some areas due for future updates, but public spaces like the pool, beach, restaurant, and lobby are well-maintained. Direct beach access with plenty of loungers and free towel service. Breakfast has plenty of options! For all cultures and tastes! Gym also good for exercising. Staff were very friendly and service-minded ‚Äî even if English wasn‚Äôt perfect. So keep that in mind. Overall: Great value and perfect beachfront location! But don‚Äôt expect a European 5-Star house.
Mr. Suharbawa is a very good teacher, we have made restorative yoga and sunrise yoga on november, we feel with energy to start the day. Thanks you very much.
Had a villa with a private pool. Huge bathroom and outdoor shower. Butler service who brought us anything we asked for. And right slap bang in the middle of Nusa Dua.
Had so much fun at the pool and the beach, service is also 10/10 hospitality! Would stay here again x
Merusaka resort at Nusa Dua was a wonderful place to stay. The staff are so friendly and efficient and the rooms and facilities are amazing. The ladies in the Spa were fantastic.
Hotelnya bagus. Ramah buat pejalan kaki, kemana-mana jalan kaki, dari lobby ke kamar dan ke tempat sarapan jalan kaki ahaha ada mobil boogie sih

We had an incredible 7 night all inclusive stay at Merusaka and it was incredible. The hospitality is outstanding and the food always delicious and the day spa is heavenly. If you are after a holiday where your biggest decision will be which pool to swim in, which cocktail to order and which restaurant to dine in - Merusaka is the resort for you. We will definitely book again.
Great hotel, amazing breakfast and fair prices for pick nick on the beach. Just scan the menu, choose and the plates will appear on your beach bed a few minutes later. Top!

We had an incredible experience at Merusaka Nusa Dua! The location is perfect ‚Äî right on a beautiful, calm beach with plenty of sunbeds for everyone. The rooms are spacious, clean, and very comfortable, and the hotel grounds are stunning, with multiple pools and lush landscaping. We loved the variety of dining options and the relaxed, elegant atmosphere throughout the resort. Most of all, we were really impressed by the staff ‚Äî everyone was welcoming, helpful, and genuinely kind. Thank you for a wonderful stay ‚Äî we‚Äôll absolutely be back!

Loved our stay here recently. Plenty of options for food and my wife is veggie and although there wasn‚Äôt much on the menu it was enough variety for a few days. Beach was great and nice walk to the peninsula along the footpath and back along the beach. We had a villa and the lagoon at the back was a nice touch üëåüèª service impeccable

We have just spent the last 3 nights of our holiday here and wished we booked here for longer, delicious food for every meal, friendly and helpful service, I want to take their bathroom home with me! Very comfortable beds and peaceful surroundings with a beautiful beach to top it off, also their live music at dinner was so good. We can't wait to return again. Suksma!

Merusaka was amazing!! The attention to detail was on another level. We only stayed for 3 days and after day 1 the staff remembered our room numbers and needs. The pools were so relaxing and had great variety. With delicious cocktails (the best we had in Bali)! The ocean access was amazing with plenty of umbrellas and lounge chairs. There were always pool/beach towels easily accessed and the staff were always so accommodating. The rooms were great sizes and were always made up fantastically. The gym was the best we've ever had while on holidays! With great variety of machinery and it was always very clean. The small market stalls were decently priced. We also enjoyed the variety of restaurants and the food was always delicious. We all loved the buffet breakfast! The in house spa was a but pricey but we made the most of the beach massages which were solid and well priced.

Great location. 5 star hotel, 30% cheaper than Grand Hyatt next door. Rooms and facilities not as well maintained as the established brands. Restaurants and breakfast very subpar. But overall, good value for the location and 4.5 star level facilities

There is only a few smaller things that would greatly lift the review. Firstly the bad: - Coffee at breakfast. It's rubbish. Nua K near by is 100x better. It wouldn't take much to have a proper barista coffee at breakfast. - shower water pressure is terrible. - bed quality is also terrible. You sink into the outline of a human indicating far too soft and due for replacement. - wifi and cell reception bad in the rooms - swim up bar at the beach club but with kids. Youve got kids ordering alcohol. The swim up bar should be at the adults pool The good: - great choices at breakfast and lovely omelettes with good food - superb location with beach front access and water activities - nice variety of swimming pools - spacious rooms with large bathrooms - good priced food and cocktails. Good strength alcohol - not watered down - well priced resort for our pool room. Gokd value

Booked 3D/2N For Long Weekend Location Directly to the Beach, The Kids Really Loves It , Spend Their Afternoon Time Fully On The beach to catch Crab & Fish The Food have Lot Of Options The Room Was Spacious & The Bathroom Was Great The Staff Really Helpfull

Beautiful resort! Something for everyone to enjoy. Great direct beach access, big rooms, multiple pools, kids loved the kiddie pool and the breakfast was delicious with all kinds of food options. Nanik and the ladies in the kids center were amazing, especially on the days that it rained some. Super clutch and the best! Would return with friends and family

I had a lovely stay at Merusaka. The rooms were comfortable, restaurants delicious, location excellent and the staff amazing and friendly. The bed was very comfortable. The gym was definitely one of the better ones for a hotel standard.

Been 5 times staying in this Hotel. This time, as just two of us, we are trying to stay at the Villa, a private complex just behind all the Puri buding (the 3 storey building where the Deluxe room available). Unless you bring your own car, Villa will require you to order the buggey car as it bit far away. Although there's a way that will shortcut to restaurant building. Villa is just perfect, with a private pool, bathup, shower and complete set of amnenities and free soda. Dedicated lobby and parking area, even you can have your breakfast at villa (less preferable for me üòÖ) Beach is good, vibe is great, pool is awesome. A lot of pool to try plus our private one. Servive is great.

Big resort with a private beach vibe I visited Merusaka Nusa Dua a few years ago during the IESF event. Didn‚Äôt stay in the rooms, so I can‚Äôt comment on that ‚Äî but the overall vibe was really nice. The place is huge, with well-kept grounds and a layout that makes it feel a bit like your own private resort. The beach area is clean and quiet, giving that peaceful, almost exclusive feeling. Perfect if you're looking to escape the crowd. It‚Äôs definitely one of those upscale, spacious resorts ‚Äî even just walking around it feels relaxing.

We had a fantastic experience at Merusaka Nusa Dua. The resort is beautifully maintained with lush gardens, direct beach access, and a peaceful pool area. The rooms were spotless and thoughtfully laid out, making it easy to relax from day one. A special mention to Dwis, who greeted us with genuine warmth at check-in and was equally professional and kind at check-out. Her hospitality really stood out and made us feel truly welcomed. Highly recommend Merusaka for anyone visiting Bali ‚Äì it‚Äôs the perfect blend of comfort, style, and heartfelt service.

Everything was perfect, the hotel was beautiful and the staff as kind as possible üôè We celebrated our wedding here and it was like a dream. Thank you to everyone and thanks to Putri, she helped me with my hair and she did an amazing job üôè I hope one day we will come back! üíñ

One star because I have to! Rooms are nice restaurant service is terrible. Waited atleast 40 minutes to receive drinks and first in first out obviously doesn‚Äôt exist in this place.Communication between morning and afternoon shift is poor as we arranged a cake for a birthday dinner which was not provided and in the end was called a liar about it being arranged. I‚Äôm glad to be leaving this place tomorrow and wouldn‚Äôt recommend anyone to come.

Worst service I have ever seen. 20 people behind the desk but only 0,5 working, the rest making jokes in front of guests. 1 hour waiting for every meal but 2 seconds to take out your plate, even if when not finished. That was just crazy. Don‚Äôt go to Merusaka nor nusa dua it is everything but Bali.

We stayed in one of the villas for our honeymoon and couldn‚Äôt have been happier with our choice. We tried all restaurants and all food was fantastic. We definitely recommend the ribs from the beach restaurant or pool bar, also the lobster from there as well ($5 surcharge). The service and manners of all employees was amazing. The bed and pillows were the best we‚Äôve ever had (sleeping for 9 hours most nights). Highly recommend this hotel and would stay here again
