Smua staff sangat ramah , pelayanan sangat baik , hotel bersih, ruang receptionis juga nyaman . Pemandangan laut sangat indah .
Lovely property. The villas are excellent with private pools and butler services. Breakfast buffet offers wide variety.

Our stay at Merusaka has been incredible. We were lucky enough to get an All Inclusive package which made our stay very easy. If you are looking for the perfect place to unwind, relax in the sun this is it. With lots of pools and beach frontage is spectacular. The staff were all very lovely, helpful and courteous. Our room was always cleaned to a high standard. Meals were very good, and having the choice of 4 restaurants we barely left the resort. If you do want to go out there is a Complimentary shuttle to Bali Collection where you'll find shopping, restaurants, massages etc. Even though Nusa Dua is away from the hustle and bustle of Kuta it's only a cheap Taxi ride away. Highly recommended Merusaka and will be happy to stay here again
Semuanyaaa sudah okee.. kamar nyaman dan bersih, staff ramah.. kurang nya cuma satu, menu breakfast nya kurang

What a fabulous and relaxing stay we had at Merusaka Nusa Dua. It exceeded our expectations from the food from the 4 restaurants, the range of activities, the accommodation and the beautiful blue and clean beach.. and there were even shops/stalls on the resort. Our massages were heavenly ! The customer service from the Reservations Team and all the staff at the hotel... polite, welcoming and always went out of their way to accommodate us. We didn't step foot outside the resort except to do a day tour and to cycle around Nusa Dua. We absolutely loved our stay and would recommend it to anyone that just wants pure relaxation for a holiday !

We stayed here 5 nights for honeymoon. Did not go to plan as husband had accident on first night, requiring urgent medical and hospital visits. Staff were SO good, had dr there within 5 minutes, duty managers and staff to assist. As well as housekeeping to clean up blood and room. Drove us to and from hospital for 3 days, buggy so he didn't have to walk around. Meals to our room if needed, even sent flowers. Resort is truly beautiful, and caring staff made it perfect. Can not fault service or attention...will definitely come again to experience total package.
We didn't stay there but we had a day pass to the beach club and the pool, food, drinks, lounge chairs and atmosphere was fantastic you could either relax or party

Recently enjoyed 5 nights here on our honeymoon. This was the first time and first place I visited in Bali, and it set the bar really high. The staff are so helpful, friendly, and nothing is ever a problem. Everything is done with a smile on their face. The room was superb, beach access, swim up bar, what more could you want on a holiday. Short walk to Bali collection was great. Food options were great, highlight was the Indonesian restaurant- best food ever!

We did 7 days at Merusaka and the hotel staff felt like family ....so friendly and engaging Service was excellent and nothing was too hard for them Pick up and return to airport was easy, $37.50 AUD each way
Good service, really really good. Friendly receptionist, give the best for our experiences stay at this hotel even only for 1 night

We stayed for 2 nights at Merusaka to celebrate my Mum's birthday and spend the last few days in Bali chilling before we flew back home. I got us 4 deluxe rooms for 8 adults and 2 kids. The room is huge and the toilet and bath is spacious enough. I just find the lightning inside the toilet too dim for my eyes. Couldnt keep the window blinds in the T&B open all the time as we're facing another building. All looked clean. The grout/tiles by the shower glass panel just needs changing/updating. The beach isnt as crowded on a Sunday. The water is clear and the beach is satisfyingly clean. My niece's 2yr old son hated the sand and the beach murky water but he thoroughly enjoyed the beach water for the first time here. He had so much fun (still wont play in the sand) and we're very happy that he did. We went to the swimming pool after. They have an outdoor shower in very convenient location near the pool area. The pool water is warm and very nice. The infinity pool lets you enjoy the view of the beach and its surrounding. Not that deep for asian height. They have kids pool as well. Breakfast buffet was decent, lots of food to choose from. They gave my mum a complimentary birthday cake and a greeting card too. The staff sang her a bday song. The gesture made my mum really happy and teary. It would have been better if I had requested in a more private setting though. We also tried Gading Restaurant. I wish the food was as great as the staff. The food was pricy and underwhelming given the long waiting time for food to be served. We tried the outside restaurant nearby (Yasa Segara), and it was so much better (fair priced, food tastes great, and serving was one of the quickest we've had in our 10days in Bali). Biggest downside: CHECK-IN I requested for a 1 twin bed and 3 kings. However the king beds arent available and so I was offered for combined twin beds on the day of check-in, which is better as they're bigger than actual king beds. I was advised to inform them if the beds arent combined so they could make them. We got there past 3pm already so I thought we wouldn't have to wait to get to our rooms but unfortunately only 2 rooms were available, and so the guest relation officer who checked us in asked for my WhatsApp number so she can inform me when the other rooms are ready. When I got to the room no. 2, the key card wasn't working so I handed it to the bell boy and informed reception, and to also request for the beds to be combined asap. We had to stay in one room with fussy kids while waiting (we're 8 adults + 2 kids). Everyone was tired and in dire need to rest. Good thing the rooms we're waiting on are on the same floor and almost next to each other. I received a message that the other rooms are ready and I can get the keycards at the reception. To be fair, I did phone the reception earlier to have the keys brought to our room once ready but because I wanted everything to sort out in person, I went to the reception even though it's kinda far and hot. The duty manager is very helpful and attentive. He gave me the keycard for the other rooms and sorted the keycard problem himself by going to the room and resetting them. He even called to sort out the complimentary bday cake for my mum. I was very frustrated with the mishap with the check-in process (rooms not being ready and the waiting time. Turns out none of the beds were combined so had to wait on for them to finish. Everyone was able to get into their rooms at past 4pm) but they managed to make up with their shortcomings. I'm sure they also didn't want any inconvenience for their guests but I hope they thoroughly check requests and room service would be quick next time. Overall, I'd still go back to Merusaka as staffs are amazing. Always warm, friendly and helpful. The beach and pool are superb. The hotel looks lovely. We had a family photoshoot too (outside photog). They offered complimentary but unfortunately the photographer is fully booked and only available on the day of our flight.

Beautiful resort! Previously called Putri Bali and later on called Inaya Putri Bali before now being called Merusaka Nusa Dua. Stayed with wife and 3 kids. Space was adequate. Breakfast spread was impressive. Private beach was clean and quiet. Very peaceful & restful resort.

Today‚Äôs experience is terrible. Hotel infrastructure is good but service is terrible. We found no hot water in shower room, told duty manager face t face, he just sent two technicians after 30mins, and told me it‚Äôs nature as the consumption is high‚Ä¶ I was shocked that they gave me this reason. I tried to call duty manager two times after but he never pickup the phone. Now it‚Äôs 2200pm and my wife and I still waiting for the hot water

The resort is located at the seashore. The location of the resort was very convenient, however I‚Äôve to be honest here as the staff was not friendly ‚Ä¶ they didn‚Äôt provide many information transparently mainly from their booking perspective. Apparently we found that child isn‚Äôt a part of family and it‚Äôs only two adults being considered as a guest‚Ä¶ rest is charged. The staff is more interested in getting bill sorted out even before your child has had their breakfast (surprised right). Even the food options and food quality wasn‚Äôt that great. They do provide additional services such as booking scooter etc., however they don‚Äôt share the correct information on the spot and you‚Äôre there to blame for. Apparently what we experienced was if you book scooter via them is almost 100k rupiah higher compared to directly dealing with the scooter rental company. According to our experience the place is over rated.

This hotel was pretty underwhelming compared to the other places we stayed in Bali. Nothing really stood out. We arrived 30 minutes before check-in and were told to wait at the restaurant until our room was ready. An hour passed with no update, so we had to follow up ourselves‚Äîonly to find out the room had been ready for a while. Given the heat and humidity, we just wanted to settle into a cooler space as soon as possible. We were hesitant to book this hotel due to its distance from the main areas, and while Bali Collection being nearby was a plus, without it, you‚Äôd feel stuck at the resort. The overall vibe wasn‚Äôt great, and the staff didn‚Äôt seem as warm or welcoming as in other places we stayed. The restaurant menu was on the pricier side, so you might want to explore other dining options. Another downside was the lack of information provided‚Äîstaff never informed us about the resort‚Äôs activities or included amenities. We had to look everything up ourselves or ask, which made the experience feel less engaging. Because of this, we ended up just staying in our room just to sleep and shower. Most of the time we were outside the hotel and never fully got to experience what the resort had to offer, if any. On top of that, you have to pay extra to rent their worn-out bikes, about $6 i think for an hour. Lol. The only decent part was the beachfront. However, the pool lounge beds were limited compared to the number of guests, so finding a spot was a challenge. Lastly, the room‚Äôs exhaust and sewage system desperately needed maintenance‚Äîit had an unpleasant smell throughout our stay. Might want to skip this hotel & choose another one! :)

First timers to Bali. Merusaka and Nusa Dua did not disappoint!!! The location was perfect. So clean, peaceful and beautiful. Beach with perfect sand. Not rocky at all. Food was fantastic. Staff all very friendly. Money exchange at the Resort was a great safe option for guests also. Will definitely be back again and recommend to anyone.
Very nice hotel. Very family friendly. Bit of a travel if you want to go places but easy transport.
Rooms are big and spacious, big variety of food, staff is super friendly, clean and beautiful beach that is near waterblow.
It was an amazing experience and resort, the food was really good and the service was excellent. The only thing it's missing is a bit more maintenance to be top notch.

This hotel is quite different in not a good way compared to other hotels we visited in Bali. It reminds me a bit a factory. The breakfast is a joke for 5 star hotel and in comparison with other hotels in Bali. Moreover, various salami, ham and cheese is left in the warmth without cooling turning almost color to green. We had to be careful what to take in order to avoid stomach issues. The restaurants are overpriced for the quality with less friendly staff. Moreover, i unexpectedly needed female sanitary products, i asked for help a male receptionist. He called someone and asked but he was telling it in the phone like in a machist way and laughing about that. He finally recommended their hotel shop but I felt very uncomfortable in this situation. All in all, probably my only mistake I made while booking hotels. Not approved. Reply to tge manager reply: No, for many salami and cheese there was no ice at all, they were left on sipmler platter. For instance in the pork station. Or in the middle of the room, from one side were juices and other side cheese and salami. The cooling was provided e.g. for milk.

Best place ever. I didn‚Äôt want to leave !!! It was epic. We stayed 5 nights in room 7103 which has access to a semi private pool. Rooms are beautiful and you have all you need. The staff are the best, I never felt so welcome and appreciated, they treat you with so much respect and the biggest smile at all times. The facilities are espectacular.
We have enjoyed so much our stay, beautiful resort with beautiful beach and food. Andre made our stay very special.

Had a fantastic stay with my daughter for her birthday. We both thoroughly enjoyed ourselves.staff are very friendly and courteous, rooms ared nice air-conditioned kept very clean, beds and towels changed daily. The restaurants are lovely, you've got 3 different restaurants to choose from and a beautiful beach right there.. infinity pools. Really enjoyed our holiday.
Absolutely amazing time spent with the all inclusive package. Food was amazing, and lots of choices from various restaurants located on site. Thanks so much for everything

Merusaka is truly the ideal resort in Bali to spend your vacation to unwind .I have been to Bali twice so far and stayed at several resorts but Merusaka is the one that stands out from the rest and will definitely go again and again.The location is perfectly situated by the ocean with gorgeous infinity pools, spacious bedrooms,tranquil surroundings and lush vegetation that takes your breath away.The breakfast at this hotel is by far the best compared to other hotel resorts.The staff professional, attentive and courteous at all times.Its the kind of resort that you don't want to leave but live in.
Great rooms, good location next to shopping close to Ubud and Ulluwatu, smiling and helpful staff. Shoutout to Puttu our driver to Ubud and Uluwatu, he was amazing!

I booked my stay through a travel agency in Bali, and since I did not make my reservation directly on Booking.com, I am leaving my review here to assist other travelers in making informed decisions. First and foremost, I want to ensure that potential guests are not misled by agencies in Bali or Romania into choosing this hotel, as it could ruin their vacation experience. The pricing is significantly inflated; it seems that travel agencies secure reservations at very low rates and then pass on the cost to tourists. Otherwise, I cannot comprehend why they would recommend a place that charges the same rates as renowned international hotels where you can genuinely find five-star service. This hotel barely qualifies as a three-star establishment. I booked four nights with breakfast, but I couldn't manage to sleep even a single night. When I requested a refund, the manager flatly refused to reimburse me. The rooms were in terrible condition‚Äîfurniture was old, mattresses were worn out, and the linens were stained as if there had been bedbugs. The air conditioning was noisy and inadequate for what one would expect from a five-star hotel, where a quiet internal ventilation system should allow for a restful night's sleep. The staff appeared poorly groomed, with dirty uniforms. The pool area was unkempt, and there was litter on the paths and beach. The overall state of maintenance is glaringly evident from the hotel lobby, where the tattered upholstery on the chairs and the dirt on the floor immediately capture your attention. I noticed that this hotel has a high rating on Booking.com; however, I suspect that unfavorable reviews may have been deleted. For those from Romania reading this, I must say that staying here feels akin to being at Eforie. I hope my experience can save others from a disappointing stay.

I was lucky to be upgraded to a room with a pool. Absolutely fabulous. The room was spacious and the bed comfortable. It was spotlessly clean with all the amenities you would expect eg iron hairdryer and a coffee machine. The pools were lovely. Great choice of restaurants and delicious buffet breakfast. All the staff everywhere were so welcoming and accommodating. The spa was amazing and very good prices

Poor service, disturbing the peace at night. ringing the bell in the middle of the night instead of knocking the door which caused our baby to wake up and cry until 3 AM. Of course it makes sense, because your staff disturbs our holiday and don't give any compensation. Your staff heard my baby crying, you as manager better not deny it.
It's gem of a place in Nusa Dua. Quiet and safe from tyicsl Bali. Staff are very kind and helpful, good food and there is lot to do around the resort. Their beach is so clean

Spent two nights here and they made sure they were the worst two nights of my life! The ac is LOUD, for a light sleeper like me I couldn‚Äôt sleep at all, and it kept dripping water, 5 star hotel? I guess not. No sound proof walls whatsoever, you can hear everything happening in the hallway or other rooms. Even the fridge was not working, is that what I paid all that money for? NEVER AGAIN Not recommended at all, stay away people

Merusaka = Paradise!!! We have just returned from 5 nights at this amazing resort. Our group of 3 families stayed in the pool access rooms, what a treat, highly recommend! The beach, the pools, the restaurants were outstanding, couldn't fault them. We were also really impressed with the service, nothing was too much of a problem... we cannot wait to come back!

Amazing experince! Kamar bersih, luas. Memiliki banyak kolam renang, anak2 senang bisa loncat ke dlm kolam, yg didekat poolbar. Untuk bfast, menu agak monoton. Jd buat kami yg stay 4hari, agak bosan dengan menunya.

- rooms were dark. - limited space to unpack. - food prices unacceptable: sandwiches are from 15 AUD. More expensive than Sydney. And not even good -buffet breakfast viennoiseries were not good as well. - Poos found at the beach pool - Common toilets dirty - mouses next to pool - nice pools - big space at reception - nice restaurants - good food service (not enough cleaning) - good location - beautiful beach - nice market stands in common area

I recently stayed at the Merusaka with my partner and we had an extremely positive experience. The resort is in a beautiful location and we were in awe of the beach! We also found the all inclusive benefit to be well worth it! The staff were kind and often went above and beyond to meet our needs. There were several staff members in particular that added value to our everyday - Juni (Ja‚ÄôJan by the sea), Sugi (Ja‚ÄôJan by the sea), Dwi (Ja‚ÄôJan by the sea) & Andre (Gading)!! We look forward to returning to the Merusaka!

Merusaka Nusa Dua is an incredible retreat . From the moment I arrived, I felt completely welcomed-the staff are attentive, warm, and go above and beyond to make every guest feel special. Their personal and genuine touch absolutely unforgettable The beachfront location is breathtaking just walking distance to the beach, feel like paradise. The rooms are spacious, elegantly designed. Dining here is a true experience. The food is thoughtfully prepared, blending local flavors Indonesian dishes. This resort isn't just a place to stay-it's an escape into a world of tranquility and comfort making it an unforgettable destination. I left feeling refreshed, inspired

The best hotel in town, dari mulai lobby hotelnya, kamarnya, breakfastnya enak2 dan banyak pilihan. Dan yg pasti anak2 seneng banget nginep disini, mau berenang di pool nya, ato private beachnya. Meskipun lokasinya lumayan di ujung, tapi kalo untuk family time ga kemana2 ini tempat yg terbaik.
All good, the room was clean, the service was great and the food was delicious. Thing needs to be improved is the internet connection - very slow to use for work (zoom call). Thanks!

Every meal, drink, and staff member we encountered at the Merusaka was the best that we have ever experienced Bali. There were only two negatives for us. * Only stayed for 5 nights (not long enough) * We watched numerous guests put their towels/belongings on pool/beach lounges and leave for up to 2-4 hours and come back afterwards. This we feel is not only rude but not fair on other guests who want to enjoy the resort as well. We would like to make a special mention about one particular staff member Bagas who worked at the pool bar. He was more than friendly and went over and above to recommend different menu items at different restaurants around the resort, he really made us feel welcomed every time we saw him. The staff at Ja'Jin By The Sea were also exceptional.

Absolutely amazing resort right on Nusa Dua Beach. Our room was very clean and spacious. The pools were very well maintained and never crowded so we always had plenty of space to ourselves. The food at all four restaurants in the resort were excellent, delicious western and Indonesian food options with a massive selection in the breakfast buffet. The staff were all incredibly friendly and always greeted us with a smile, made us really feel at home. it We had a fantastic stay here and can't wait to be back! From Mongolian friends üá≤üá≥

Mahandra and his team/s provide a luxury escape that is out of this world!!! A perthfect place to celebrate a 50th or any birthday üôè I'm a Bali convert üëè After 37 years I'm back at Denpasar and very happy to experience a small sample of what Nusa Dua has to offer üôè
What a fantastic resort , all inclusive, staff were very friendly. Food was sensational and loved the mini bar that was replenished daily at no cost highly recommend

‚Äú A Perfect Stay in Paradise!‚Äù Our stay at MERUSAKA Nusa Dua was nothing short of amazing. The hotel is in a perfect location, just 25 minutes from the airport and right next to a shopping area, making everything easily accessible. The beach is pristine, the pools are fantastic, and the restaurants offer delicious food. What truly sets this place apart is the incredible staff‚Äîattentive, friendly, and always ready to assist. Whatever we needed was arranged within minutes, making our experience seamless and enjoyable. The only minor issue was a slight humidity smell in the room, but given the tropical climate, it was expected and didn‚Äôt impact our overall experience. If you‚Äôre looking for a luxurious and relaxing stay in Nusa Dua, this is the place to be. A well-deserved 5-star experience

Second time visiting here and the service levels are just as high as I remembered. Perfect location and literally on the Beachfront . Food was great and the staff always smiling, courteous, personable. The room cleaning headed by Mr Sukra as always went out of his way to make sure your room was spotless. A real joy to come back. Thank you.
Accommodation was clean, the staff wonderful and the food lovely. The location was safe and direct access to the beach. Could not have faulted as stay for seven nights.
Very nice hotel. We've enjoed daily cleaning services. Very good breakfast there.

My wife and I bought an all inclusive package, departing Sydney. Included were transfers to and from Denpasar airport, all meals, afternoon tea and drinks hours, restocking of minibar, 2 great massages, car and driver for 6 hrs, daily room servicing. Some drinks and meals had a surcharge but we ate and drank well without choosing those and more was available than we could use. The location was right on the beach in a beautiful area. Our stay was perfectly organised by reception, without a single glitch. The Balinese people are beautiful, ever smiling, welcoming and helpful, both inside Merusaka Resort and in Bali generally.
Amazing place with amazing people, especially Bayu who helped us with everything and made us feel at home. Definitely recommended and will definitely be back soon!

The 5 star hotel service did not disappoint and we always feel at home as citizens of our home country Philippines, locals we've met and have worked with, always understood our requirements for our special event . Thank you so so much, we will surely come back again . Terima Kasih!

Beautiful resort, spacious, crystal clear pools, a very enjoyable stay. Restaurant staff mostly attentive but make big mistakes with orders not arriving to table when it‚Äôs not a busy time. Would return for a future stay.
Beautiful resort All Staff were kind gentle and happy and always smiling. Food & Drinks was yum & tasty... Highly recommend Merusaka for a great relaxing holiday ü©µüêøüå¥üå∫

Absolutely loved this property although your food is amazing you must have been a bit understaffed at dinner as service was a bit slow in saying that your staff are all beautiful friendly people and I would recommend this resort to my family and friends great time

Exceptional Stay at Merusaka Nusa Dua! From the moment I arrived, everything about this hotel was outstanding. The room was spacious, beautifully designed, and impeccably clean, with a stunning balcony view. The facilities were top-notch‚Äîmultiple pools, a well-equipped gym, and a serene private beach. The spa was a highlight, offering one of the best Balinese massages I‚Äôve ever had. Dining was a delight, with a fantastic variety of dishes across the restaurants. The breakfast buffet was especially impressive. A special thanks to the housekeeping team for their impeccable service and thoughtful touches. The entire staff was warm, welcoming, and truly made my stay unforgettable. Highly recommend Merusaka Nusa Dua

It is not advisable for Indians if you are Vegetarian. Highly disappointed by the Food. In Breakfast there was only Aalu Baji and Pakoda for Vegetarians in Asian Restaurant . Everything else was with Egg or Non veg. On request they made Aalu paratha which was tasteless and completely raw. Not recommended for Vegetarians at all. Big NO to Indians if you prefer Pure Veg
Had a great stay here. Hotel was big and clean. Thanks to Alit for taking good care of us.

Very nice hotel. Beautiful beach. Staff is polite and helpful. Food in restaurants a bit pricy and portions are not very big. We had a few problems in the room. All of them were sorted out in minutes after contacting reception staff. We liked bar in the pool. Plenty of sunbeds by the sea. Towels available all day. Market and loads of restaurants in a short walk outside hotel. The only thing we missed is any kind of entertainment programme in the evenings. No dance or music, only quiet nights

I wish I could say better things but the stay was merely ok. Nusa Dua is a nice place to stay but this hotel is far from 5 stars. You can find in other reviews about the hotel infrastructure and the rooms. What I am here to point out is the delay on returning the deposit that they ask. Yes, they ask you for a 2,000,000 rupiah deposit which is about 115 euros and well... I have no idea when I'm getting my money back. I have messaged their guest services and it was indeed a fast reply saying that their bank is taking long to reply. They have sent emails to the bank but who knows? I can't be the first one to pay this deposit by credit card so what the hell is the problem? 10 business days gone and no refund yet. Maybe I'll come back in a couple of days to say I was stolen.

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê Merusaka Nusa Dua is pure paradise. The resort is beautifully maintained with lush gardens, elegant architecture, and a stunning beachfront. Rooms are spacious and luxurious, and the staff go above and beyond. A perfect stay for total relaxation.
Sunrise yoga with Beny was very therapeutic and lovely way to wake up in the morning by the beach with under the trees.
The best banget pelayanan,fasilitas,kamar,view dan lain lain. Staff staff nya patut diappresiasi. Bakalan balik nginep sini lagi dah

16 June 2025; Second time here, the resort is lovely well layout has all the amenities that are needed, swimming pools, biking, luggage chairs for the ocean, bars room service and pool side service as well! The only thing that impacted our stay was transiting to the Airport. There no hold over area with air conditioning just an area to wait before leaving to the Airport. We asked for a late check out we were told 1:30? 1:30 is not a late check out 3:30 or 4:30 in most resort that this would be a good time for a late check. There are is not a hold over area to play table pool, watch TV, with wi-fi in aircon area. Other than that I still recommend coming here it‚Äôs a nice place. ‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî- Me and my lovely wife spent a we here. This resort is wonderful it has everything you need. The restaurant is awesome, beach access multiple pools. Adult pools with bar all view of the ocean. The spa was very nice as well. We had a blast. I differently recommend. Bail excepts my debt card, visa and master card with issue that I was a foreigner. Well recommended
The beach at this hotel is very dirty, with plastic waste scattered everywhere. The rooms and service are average. Overall, it's just so-so.

Wonderful Resort Experience The resort was beautiful, the room spotless, and the staff incredibly friendly and helpful. We enjoyed the delicious food and peaceful ambiance. A perfect getaway ‚Äî highly recommended!
The best wedding place in Bali, the staff is very friendly and humble, quick to respond and very helpful, thank you for gita who is always responsive and also wiwik, thank you
Merusaka Nusa Dua is a fantastic place to stay. The views are stunning, the breakfast is delicious, and the rooms are very comfortable.

It is at the beach and with nice swimming pool. But as a 5 star hotel it should be better. The room is old and noisy. Other inconsiderate travellers started walking in the hall very early. I can even hear next door go to toilet. I stayed at 5 different hotels in Bali. This is the most uncomfortable and noisy one I stayed. In Ubud, there ar many other nice hotels as 3 star but better than this. Service is low quality compared to other 5 star hotels.

The Resort is good The beach is good The staff are excellent The food is ordinary at all 3 restaurants We were here last November and the quality of the food was much better than now Apart from the beach bar restaurant which was good for food and drinks we ate at the three restaurants twice each but were very disappointed which is going to be embarrassing as we have talked this place up to friends that are coming in September October and March next year

Merusaka Nusa Dua is a good hotel with great facilities, but the service could be improved. After experiencing other exceptional hotels in Bali with outstanding service, this one falls slightly short in comparison. The facilities are excellent, with a large swimming pool area and a beautiful private beach. The beach is very clean, the ocean is crystal clear, and the private setting adds to its charm. Service, however, was not up to the mark. While we understand it‚Äôs a large and busy hotel, the personalized attention that Bali is known for was lacking. I‚Äôd rate the service 3 stars. The food is decent but not exceptional. The buffet offers a wide variety, though it‚Äôs more of a standard spread for breakfast and lunch rather than something extraordinary. We also dined at one of the beachside restaurants, but the food was just average. I‚Äôd recommend booking a pool access room, which shares a pool among six rooms. It‚Äôs a relaxing option when spending time in your room. The room size is decent, but the overall vibe of the hotel feels more commercial than boutique. Overall, it‚Äôs a nice place to stay, especially for its facilities and beach, but the service and food could use some improvement.
Nice place to stay with family..Continental Breakfast ,swimming pool,Beach front ,Sunrise..perfect to spend a week.. .

The best thing about this hotel are the swimming pools. They are absolutely 5 stars. Comparing to other hotels in Nusa Dua, Merusaka has the largest and most beautiful pools. They are not crowded and are open 24h. Rooms are nice, quite spacious, with stunning bathrooms. The balcony is very small though, and has just one chair so it is impossible to enjoy it. Breakfast has a lot of variety and most of it tastes good, but it gets very crowded. The beach is good too, with a lot of sunbeds. It is also very convenient that every table/sunbed has a QR code so you can order food and drinks easily without having to call the waiters. There are however 2 reasons why I gave 4 stars and not 5. The hotel is a bit old, parts of it really need some fixing/renovation. For example beach towels are old and ripped, with stains, as well as the mats on the sunbeds. Also some of the wooden tiles around the pool are damaged. The second reason for giving 1 star less is the fact that side exit gate is poorly lit at night, as you climb the stairs, the lights shine directly up into your eyes instead of lighting the stairs, so I fell and twisted my ankle. But in general the hotel is fine and I would recommend it

Absolutely Beautiful Resort. üòç We were here 5 years ago when it was Inaya Putri. Lovely grounds. Amazing beach. Places to eat. Walkable Relaxing. Pools, busy but ok. Relaxing by the beach. Breakfast was awesome. A must stay place .

The stay in this hotel is totally worth it! The rooms and particularly the suites are spacious and very clean, the breakfast has a big variety of food options (Asian, European Indian, etc.) and the location is very good, since the hotel is near Bali Collection. The staff is very helpful and continuously trying their best to make your visit unique. Lastly, the hotel facilities are exceptional and make you feel like you are in paradise. We will definitely come back!

Absolutely gorgeous hotel, very friendly people. Do your research so you know what activities you want to do. Lovely place weather is absolutely gorgeous. Restaurant staff, Andre is a good host, served us dinner and breakfast. Komang, the main girl at breakfast that we saw daily, Always with a smile.

Room is lovely, clean, spacious annd comfortable, although noisy with people walking past. Check in took too long, no welcome extras. Lots of exclusions that aren‚Äôt clear when booking the all inclusive package. Restaurants are limited and regularly ran out of food or drinks we wanted.

Review for Merusaka Nusa Dua, Bali Merusaka Nusa Dua is an absolute paradise! The resort is breathtaking, with a vast, impeccably maintained garden filled with lush greenery, towering palm trees, and stunning infinity pools that seem to merge with the ocean. The white sand beach is pristine and soft, creating the perfect tropical escape. The staff are incredibly kind, always greeting you with warm smiles and genuine hospitality. The food is fantastic, offering a variety of delicious options that cater to all tastes. Despite visiting at the end of the rainy season, the weather was perfect, making our stay even more enjoyable. Every corner of this resort exudes beauty and tranquility. Some rooms could use a slight update, but that‚Äôs more of a minor detail than an actual issue. If you‚Äôre looking for a luxurious and serene getaway in Bali, Merusaka Nusa Dua is the place to be!

Hotel is good but hotel is not good for indians no veg food is availabel here, also in request they did not look after this when average 10 % guest is indian also in non veg you feel nothing their as a indian food if your choice indian please check before coming i am here today but i am disapointed here

You never get a second chance at a first impression! We normally stay at the Melia which was under renovations. So we thought to try the Merusaka all inclusive package for 4 pool access rooms seven months ago and the only request was we be close together. Upon arrival all rooms were separated and we asked if possible did they get the correspondence (subject to availability) The next night they were able to accomodate our rooms together which was nice but probably could've been avoided seeing the room bookings were all under my name. Arriving at 1pm we left our baggage at reception to wait for our room or check-in at 3pm. Check out mean't the all inclusive package ended at 12 noon (including free Wifi) unlike the Melia where they were accommodating from your arrival until your departure airport transfers. The menu never changes and extra surcharges applied for certain meals.

Came back home a week ago from this hotel. What can I say, Great hotel with reasonable prices, only weaker side was food, a bit limited choice, we have chosen to eat in outside most of days. Location was great , friendly staff, grounds are kept tidy. There is nothing to complain about

I loved staying here and would probably return. A bubble of paradise, we had a room that had its own pool(shared with three other rooms but we rarely intersected). We ordered room service a lot as it was quite good value for money and really tasty. The international restaurant was the best, however the beach bar was disappointing unfortunately(weird how it can be so different in the same location). Oh and please try their spa, the hot oil marma point massage was exquisite.

The hotel is nice and well presented. Staff are polite, but very slow with service. I don't recommend the all inclusive package. The all inclusive package has its own menu with limited choices and surge charges on certain meals. They do not have room service included in the all inclusive package. You also seem to be at the end of the line for service at the restaurants once they see your all inclusive wrist band, slowing down their service even more. There have been occasions that up to three non exclusive tables received their drinks and food before ours, but ordered their order after ours.

During my recent business trip, I had the opportunity to stay at an established hotel for two nights. Despite its age, the property impressed me with its well-maintained condition and cleanliness. My arrival experience was seamless, thanks to the company's efficient handling of the check-in process. Each morning, I looked forward to the diverse breakfast spread. The variety of options catered to different tastes, and I found the flavors particularly appealing to my palate. This pleasant start set a positive tone for my days at the hotel. As I navigated my stay, I observed that the overall experience met a satisfactory standard. The rooms, common areas, and amenities all functioned as expected, contributing to a comfortable visit. However, one aspect caught my attention. The front office staff, while professional, appeared to be under considerable pressure. Their constant busyness suggested a potential understaffing issue, which might impact guest service during peak times. In conclusion, while the hotel delivered a generally positive experience, addressing the staffing situation at the front desk could elevate the overall quality of service and guest satisfaction.

We came here over new year for 7 nights and had a great time! Foam party was super fun and the new year celebration was too! The hotel is very modern and clean and our rooms (pool access) were made for us by the cleaning staff. We got the floating breakfast on our last morning and it‚Äôs delicious. Would recommend! The food in the hotel has been excellent with plenty of choice and high quality, aswell as a great drink selection. There are plenty of places to sit around the numerous pools and you are served food and drinks to your sunbed which you can order via the app. All of the staff here have been outstanding and very helpful and pleasant. The location is great as you are right on the beach and only a five minute walk from the Bali collection (a great shopping area). Thank you very much Merusaka for an amazing stay! We hope to come back someday

We were there for a wedding. Loved our room - gigantic bed and oversized pillows, I slept really well. Huge shower, free standing bath. Fresh towels and bottled water each day. Buffet breakfast was amazing, huge variety of foods. All staff were very friendly and warm

We booked an all inclusive 5 night stay here through Luxury Escapes. The staff were absolutely lovely, food and service great. The resort does look a little run down in places. They constructing and upgrading the decks around the terraced pools so the drop saw, hammer drill etc were very noisy when trying to relax by the pool and at the main bar. The rooms are extremely noisy, other inconsiderate guests yelling in the halls, constantly ringing door bells and walking crying babies around at 10pm ecco through the entire block. Our last night was particularly horrendous with a group of foreign travellers partying in the ground floor pool of block 4 until midnight, drinking, yelling, laughing, singing and blasting music. Twice we had to call security and eventually they were made to go inside the second time security came. It definitely put a sour taste in our mouth at the end of our holiday and instead of going home we'll rested we are tired and grumpy.

I so wanted to enjoy a stay in a 4 star hotel in Nusa Dua. Unfortunately, what we got was disappointment. Firstly, I want to point out the staff were amazingly friendly. Otherwise, we felt we'd dropped into the twilight zone. Nothing about it being Balinese authentic, apart from the beautiful staff. Yes, the pools are nice and the beach lovely. Magnificent building. However, I could have been anywhere but not Bali. The breakfast was like an old fashioned cafeteria style. Food ok but no atmosphere at all. Again staff couldn't be more friendly. This hotel and Nusa Dua I feel is ok for people who want to go to Bali but have none of the Balinese culture. We stayed one night of three. Choosing to lose the money we'd paid and ran back to Sanur. Obviously not for us.
Stayed in for 6 days. Impeccable service, nice food, great fun at foam party and an amazing romantic dinner at the beach.
Excellent resort, superb service, and fantastic location. We had a wonderful time, thank you.

Stay for 3 nights in June 2023 Lovely luxury hotel Room was luxury with access to pool Bed. Very nice and comfortable Food is amazing Pool gas great view Easy access to beach Staff give 5 star services

Jarak dari Lobby ke lokasi kamarnya naik buggy car krn lumayan jauh klo jalan kaki, tp tetap aman nyaman jalanannya. Utk sarapan menunya cukup banyak tp yang gak begitu banyak variasinya..coba lebih perbanyak variasi makanannya, akses ke pantai jalan ke belakang arah kolam renang..pantainya cukup bersih, pasir putih.. nginep di hotel ini ga cukup kalau sebentar, enaknya nginep lama krn fasilitasnya yg banyak. Next time klo ke Bali pengen lagi nginep di merusaka ü´∂

Worst experience in Bali of the 2 times I came here. 4 times I asked for king bed room, 4 times was assured everything will be done for me to receive it. Upon checkin, they regretfully inform me that garden view rooms are unavailable with king beds, and we receive a two bed room - with stains on the sofa, no charging place for phones, lacking other basic things and just rusty and dated. After complaining, in 1 hour, magically the king bed room appears and we are offered to change to it. Ventilation system is so loud even on low, that it is impossible to sleep. This place is really overpriced for what it offers.

This is a huge hotel. It desperately needs to renovated and needs major upgrades.Everything is less than mediocre. It is definitely not a 5 star resort. Prices are high for the quality of service , food, and cleanliness. I wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone.

Very spacious & comfortable rooms. Attractive grounds. Food good, but not large portions. Appreciated being able to use shower facilities at gym as check out was 12pm & our flight not until evening. N.B. Your access to WiFi is cut off after check out time.

We are deeply disappointed with our experience at this resort. We specifically chose this destination to escape the chaos of Canggu, only to find ourselves in an even louder environment. Throughout our stay, there was an incredibly noisy wedding happening, completely ruining any chance of relaxation. As a family of four, it was impossible for us to enjoy our time‚Äîour children were unsettled and uncomfortable due to the constant, deafening noise throughout the venue. To make matters worse, we couldn‚Äôt even enjoy a peaceful walk on the beach without feeling like we were intruding on the wedding. When we brought up our concerns at checkout, both the receptionist and manager on duty showed zero empathy. There was no apology‚Äîjust a dismissive response that this kind of disruption was normal and something we should accept. Frankly, that attitude was infuriating. On top of all this, the restaurant staff couldn‚Äôt even get our orders right, making mistakes multiple times during our short two-night stay. This was far from the relaxing getaway we were hoping for, and we won‚Äôt be coming back.

This hotel under new Merusaka management is very disappointing. I requested a simple booking amendment, but their response was slow, unprofessional, and not in line with the stated policy. Poor customer service and misleading advertising ‚Äî very untrustworthy. I was excited to come back second time around now I am not comfortable retuning with their rude responses , no empathy given just money hungry. Old management was better. I was due to come back and do a critic after being advised that hotel quality has changed. Looks like this is right! Hospitality has been above and beyond. Rooms are super spacious and clean! Their bath tubs are to die for. Perfect location, walk to Bali connection and other places in nusa dua. 4 restaurants are all generous in food servings; all super delicious, spa is divine, huge kids pool, adult pools, lots of kids activities in kids club and beach activities. Staff are super helpful with kids and security is top notch. The beach also is at your door step, just Pristine. We have stayed at the Sofitel and grant Hyatt in the past. This hotel makes them Look over rated. We will definitely be coming back. Also restaurants offer different entertainment on different nights. Lots of things to do, that you don‚Äôt want to go anywhere else! Thank You for making our family Holiday super fun!
Kalo nginep disini, ga perlu kemana2 Paling makan siang sama makan malem aja si Sisanya fasilitas hotel sudah lengkap semua Kalo nginep di amantera juga sama

The worst service one could ever expect from a 5 star resort , staff is so rude and not even ready to listen we had booked for king size beds and they gave us twin beds The 3 families are with kids and yet they expect us to accommodate on twin beds. HIG being a hospitality brand has the least hospitable staff, with zero politeness. Would not recommend the place to anyone in the future.

Hotel favorit saat ke Bali, meskipun sudah 5 kalo menginap dan dapat puri yg paling jauh dari Lobby tapi karena buggie car selalu siap siaga mengantar jadinya tidak masalah, punya akses langsung ke pantai , kamar bersih lengkap dengan amenities dan bathub. Cuma sarapan varian kurang dan rasanya kurang nendang , lainnya oke banget

First they didn't give us room on check-in time and then after approx 1 hr wait they allocate us a double bed room instead of king size which they assign during registration. After calling their support for 1-2 hrs they were of no help .. support staff were just repeating same lines.,.we will get you call back but no one called.. finally we again went to reception and complaint then he reassigned the rooms after 45 min approx . Not to mention the long queues in reception. People were standing in queue to checkin and check out. Very bad service for a high end resort .

I have been travelling to Bali for 35 years and I can honestly say that we had the most fabulous time. From the moment we were welcomed at reception right through to our leaving 1 week later I could fault nothing.

We recently hosted a three-day conference at Merusaka Nusa Dua with our client, and it was a complete success. The hotel team was incredibly accommodating, working closely with us to ensure every detail was executed flawlessly. A special thank you to Made Yuliarta, our main point of contact, who was instrumental in coordinating all aspects of the event. Agus and Anom from the hotel staff also went above and beyond to assist us with every request, ensuring a seamless experience for our team and guests. Their professionalism, responsiveness, and dedication truly made a difference.

Kamar secara design bagus ya berasa tinggal di bali karena tradisional sprti bentuk desa penglipuran. Di akses jalan ad tmpt jualan yg hrga oke2. Dan akses pantai yg bagus. Ad beach club nya. Untuk breakfast bervariasi. Ad kids club jg.
The most awesome property ever. In terms of location, in terms of staff and in terms of all the facilities this place is superb

The wife and I were here for 10 days followed by my Son and Daughter and her fianc√©e. We all had a great time. We had photo shoot, romantic dinner on the beach followed by a beach picnic on the last day. We could not speak any higher on the resort Fantastic staff and food. Recommend to all
Nice room,Indonesia & western resto ,large swimingpool,live musik @night,you can also cycling,surfing ,

Best place I've ever been! Fantastic people, proactive and lovely staff, excellent rooms, immaculate beach. There's not a single thing negative about anything! I just loved every single second by their side! ‚ô• Makasi!

I recently stayed at Merusaka Nusa Dua and had a pleasant overall experience. The hotel offers a beautiful environment with great views, a fantastic location near the ocean, and plenty of spacious walking areas to explore around the resort. The tranquil atmosphere of Nusa Dua adds to the appeal, making it a perfect choice for a relaxing getaway. The hotel facilities are impressive, and it was thoughtful of them to provide umbrellas for guests during the rainy days. The breakfast spread had a wide variety of options, but I found the quality and taste of the food could use improvement. The rooms were big and spacious, which was a major plus, but the furniture is noticeably in need of renovation. Room cleaning services were somewhat inconsistent and would benefit from better attention to detail. One standout aspect was the staff, who were exceptionally friendly and responsive, ensuring that guest needs were addressed promptly. A pro tip for future guests: opt for a room away from the ballroom and restaurant areas to avoid potential noise disruptions. Overall, Merusaka Nusa Dua offers a peaceful retreat with stunning surroundings, but there are a few areas, particularly maintenance and food quality, that need improvement to elevate the guest experience further. I‚Äôd still recommend it for those looking for a serene stay in Bali.
Excellent..quiet beach, big cozy room, big bathroom.. If you have any request for your stay,don't use email.. Maybe they will missed the mail or not read it at all.
Bermalam di merusaka sangat menyenangkan tempat yang sangat memuaskan ditambah dengan privat beach yang sangat bersih .
Beautiful resort, gardens immaculate, restaurants clean and quality food and plenty of it. Staff are friendly and can not do enough for you, definitely will be back

Not worth the money. The room was ok. Breakfast had a big choice, but the quality was not equal a 5-star-restaurant. Staff at the reception + the complaint manager were nice, but the further you went away from reception, the less helpful and friendly the stuff was. Would not recommend it.

The booking process is a nightmare, with errors on reservation that no one bothered to resolve. The welcome service was non-existent, and I was left standing at the reception for an unreasonably long time before being checked in. To make matters worse, there was no fan or AC available at the reception, making it unbearable to wait. Definitely not what you'd expect from a 5-star hotel. Would never recommend any one. This 5* is worst then the non star hotel.

This hotel was a complete disappointment. The room was shockingly outdated, and the air conditioning unit was utterly inadequate. Not only did it fail to provide sufficient cooling, but it also sprung a leak during my stay. To add insult to injury, my wife was viciously attacked by bedbugs, leaving blood stains all over the bedding. The hotel's response was utterly inadequate. They merely offered to change the sheets, displaying a complete disregard for the severity of the situation. Only after significant pressure did they agree to relocate us to a different room. No other form of compensation was offered, and the duty manager Gusti's attitude was appalling, insisting that these were simply usual Bali bugs/mosquitos, a claim that is both insulting and inaccurate especially given the photo evidence. The breakfast experience was equally appalling. Snaking long queues to be seated every morning and guests were forced in the scorching sun or rain, as staff callously refused to allow them to wait in the shade. It was so bad I checked out a night early (which they refused to refund), and I strongly advise all potential travelers to steer clear of this substandard establishment.

Absolutely amazing resort right on Nusa Dua Beach. Our room was very clean and spacious. The pools were very well maintained and never crowded so we always had plenty of space to ourselves. The food at all four restaurants in the resort were excellent, delicious western and Indonesian food options with a massive selection in the breakfast buffet. The staff were all incredibly friendly and always greeted us with a smile, made us really feel at home. My partner is also coeliac and they made sure she had gluten free options for breakfast every morning and prepared her gluten free toast, waffles, pancakes, stir fried rice noodles and fried rice. On top of that all the restaurants had plenty of gluten free options for her to choose from, it was great to see they catered so well to dietary requirements too. We had a fantastic stay here and can‚Äôt wait to be back!

Clearly the worst hospitality we received during our time in Bali! While the location of the hotel is great, our experience here was soured by the terrible customer service we received from the duty manager upon arrival. Though we understand (as was explained to us) that the hotel had received an incorrect booking code for the room type we had booked on trip.com, we felt that the matter could have been handled a lot better by the manager, who could have shown a little goodwill towards their guests, considering we had shown her a copy of our booking confirmation. We were given a standard deluxe room even though we had booked one with pool access, and were told that if we wanted the room we had booked (and already paid for) we would have to offer a guarantee! Thankfully, the trip.com agent we chatted to was able to resolve the issue within a couple of hours, and we were able to check into our correct hotel room later. The manager offered no response or apology for the incident, showing a complete lack of care in their guest. Pros: The location is the best thing about this place, near a pleasant beach and a close walk to the Bali Collection shopping area. The staff handling the luggage and driving the carts were great. Cons: The room we received was dated and had a musty smell that would occasionally waft through. Also, the first room we had to check in to had a shower that was in need of repair. Some of the staff could be a bit more helpful. For example, there was a very long line at checkout. I approached the concierge to ask if there was a quicker way to check out as we just needed to drop the cards off. I was told no, that I had to join the queue. It was only later while speaking to another hotel guest that I found out there was a self-checkout computer at the front desk. I‚Äôm not sure if it‚Äôs a lack of training with the staff, but things like this are important to us guests. TLDR: Nice location, terrible hospitality from the duty manager, tired musty room.

Best resort experience of my life so far. The whole place is gorgeous, with an amazing landscape and beautiful beach. It has its own holiday vibe. The rooms are spacious. Ground floor rooms have swimming pools just outside the door. There were folks from all over the globe there, which reflected very well in the food options they serve. There are a few stalls in case you want to get some cool souvenirs or dresses within the premises. Would definitely recommend it to everyone going to Bali.
Good place to stay. Giving new ambience. Beach are great! Service is nice~

Fantastic experience! Lovely staff, great service, fabulous food and spoilt for choice. From the moment we checked in we felt very well looked after. We booked the private pool access room, with an all inclusive package, this was money very well spent, great selection of food and drinks, free flowing drinks and cocktails, only a few items (steak and seafood) that required a additional surcharge but this was very resonable between $5 and $8 AUD extra, for these special meals. A great variety of food and drinks across 4 different restaurants, we tried them all. We were never disappointed as all the food was great. We did the special Oyster night event and the Oysters were live, freshly shucked prior to serving. YUMMO! Also you must try their signature Nasi Goreng absolutley delicious! A special shout out to Purnama, and all the staff at Gading restaurant, great service, always with a smile and nothing is a problem for them. They have to deal with so many issues and just outright, rude, entitled, nasty, people but they always manage to smile and resolve any issues. Again, amazing staff that do a fabulous job of making all guests comfortable. I was surprised to see a few negative Google reviews before we arrived, and was a bit hesitant booking, but once we arrived all my worries quickly melted away. For anyone reading these reviews, ignore the negatives, they are most likely from the nasty, rude, entitled guests mentioned above. We will definitely be back to Merusaka, just a fantastic experience all round. 10 out of 10! Thanks to all the team at Merusaka we are looking forward to seeing you all again next year. Suksma!
Merusaka was a great place to stay. All stuff were absolutely wonderful. Wouldn't hesitate to stay again.
Okay hotel. Great staff. Breakfast buffet was kinda so-so

Good evening, my experience is knowing that my cousin works so much and I am the heir and partner of Yper Investment Limited, Indonesia, Jacast Capital City and owner of the hotels that belong to Yper, thank you.

I had a deeply disappointing experience at this so-called 5-star hotel, which turned out to be both unprofessional and utterly underwhelming. The staff were extremely rude, untrained, and ill-equipped to handle guests or manage a crowd. The facilities were nowhere near the standards expected of a 5-star property, and the breakfast options were limited and of poor quality. What made the experience even worse was the apparent favoritism shown toward Caucasian guests, while those who were brown, like us, were blatantly ignored. This behavior felt like soft racism and was incredibly disheartening. During breakfast on one occasion, a staff member accidentally sprayed cleaning detergent in my wife‚Äôs direction and hit her with a chair while trying to accommodate a Caucasian family. Instead of apologizing, they attempted to justify their actions, which was both unprofessional and insulting. Basic services were also shockingly absent. For instance, there were no umbrellas provided in the corridors during the rainy season. After check-out, there was no one available to assist with our luggage, and we had to carry heavy bags across multiple levels on our own. During my 15-day trip to Bali, I stayed at four different hotels, and this was by far the worst experience, despite being the most expensive. The unprofessionalism, substandard facilities, and discriminatory behavior made it a place I will never return to. I strongly advise others to avoid this hotel.

An amazing resort in an amazing location with top service. Rooms were a very good size, very good amenities but rooms were a little dated. Some refurbishments could be made but a very good room nonetheless. Service was very good, staff were more than happy to accommodate us and our requests, even at breakfast. The beach was pristine, the pools were clean and ample amounts of seating/loungers. We very much enjoyed our stay here and would recommend for anyone looking to stay in Nusa Dua.

We visited Bali, and Nusa Dua was our last stop! We had a lot of options to choose from as Nusa Dua has lot of resorts, however considering the reviews of this hotel we chose this and it was a great decision! We were on our honeymoon and my husband's birthday, this hotel arranged for a cake upon request and even decorated our room with flower petals along with the bathtub! The location is just amazing and has breathtaking views from the property . The room however had no great view. They have 3 large swimming pools and private access to the beach. The breakfast options for vegetarians were very limited so we were little disappointed with that. The room was spacious and even the bathrooms were spacious. Please note - there is no jet spray in the washroom so please carry a portable in need. The buggy from entrance to main hotel entrance is very limited so wait time is alot. We prefered walking in this case. Rest we had an amazing time at this property, enjoyed alot and had a really good overall experience.

We stayed in two rooms the one on the third floor felt newer and cleaner than the one on the ground floor with a pool access. However, we enjoyed our stay in both rooms and had no issues or complaints during our stay, the staff was very friendly and accomdating. I noticed the price of the water sports next to the resort beach were higher that some people recommended using the agencies outside the resorts and in Kuta area.

I stayed with my wife in this hotel in July 2024. The experience was truly amazing from start to finish. A special mention to Andre who has always served us perfectly. Extraordinary mention for the service of romantic meal on the beach, we were pampered It is very clear that we will return soon.

The hotel is comfortable and have an access to the beach, service was adorable‚Ä¶ breakfast are good enough with a lot of variety of food‚Ä¶ the restaurant for breakfast also big facing to the garden view They have small shop/souvenir around the way we go to the hotel room, so unique. The hotel is already old and the way go to my room was have dark lighting make it lil bit creepy when you walk at night, hoping they add more lights in the future.. (-) the valet parking was confusing, first there‚Äôs a guy who told me to park by my self which is lil bit far away from the hotel location‚Ä¶ i went there but there‚Äôs no people from the hotel ‚Äúpick us up‚Äù to the lobby‚Ä¶. Then i back drive the car to front of the lobby and meet different ‚Äúguy‚Äù that said he will park my car so i can do check-in‚Ä¶. I mean why don‚Äôt you told me at first and make me wait up to 1 hour to figure out what to do with my car üòÇ (but that‚Äôs okay, maybe he was a new team, idk) However i still willing to give this hotel 5 star ‚≠êÔ∏è
I've been here for meeting. The meeting room was amazing, clear sound, and nice food.
We have just completed our 3rd stay in 4 years and thoroughly enjoyed it as usual. We love the location, staff are fantastic and we enjoyed all of the restaurants and the spa.

The worst of the hotels I stayed at in Bali. Service was mostly appalling. Guy looking after the old stained and ripped pool towels was telling us the pool was closed at 7pm cos he clearly didn‚Äôt want to do any more work. Pool staff had to go get us a towel from him- pool stays open till late. Pool staff just stand in a group. We had bottles, glasses and food plates stacked up for hours at the table, this had the flys swarming in the area. In room bath was not clean and had sand grit in there the first day. Dated and worn out facilities, ripped beach lounge seat cushions All inclusive package was not worth it. Worst pizza I‚Äôve ever had. Indonesian restaurant had good food tho. Had 4 included massages but place was already booked out for our trip. Even tho I messaged ahead of time and asked if I needed to pre book restaurants/ spa and they said no Waste of money, did not enjoy! Not relaxing.

Spend 2 nights in this hotel. In room with pool access.. The room is big enough, long poll beside the room and have direct access. Pool only for 2 rooms. There are bath tub, shower etc. Walking at the beach in the early morning, sounds of wave, beautiful view with fresh air. It's my third time in this hotels and I love it.

Kamar bersih, makanan enak tp arrangement brantakan ga di rapiin, jd kliatan unappetizing. Reception liat bule disapa2 dg heboh. Liat muka gw lokal indo cm ditatapin n gw dg anehnya inisiatif samperin spy proses cek in. Minta liat detail bookingn dr apps agoda ku. Pdhl rata2 di sistem hotel hrsnya sdh ad donk detailnya. Wth. ü§¶‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è anyway staff lain helpful, ga rasis kyk receptionist .

Visually, this is a stunning resort no doubts about that. The gardens are immaculate, the pools are plentiful and access to the beach is perfect. It feels like its within a gated community. The resort on face value is 5 star but when you get into it it falls a little short. Little things like paper napkins instead linen (for all meals including dinner) When you sit at a table they are slow to attend to it with cutlery, menu's. The pressure on one dining area for breakfast was too much, there was a large conference at the hotel the same time we stayed and really the hotel should use the other dining spaces to break up the amount of people, there is a Indonesian restaurant area but that was only Indonesian food. = breakfast had a large selection but was to cluttered and chaotic. Service is so slow and lacked attention to detail - we asked for a chicken wrap to NOT include tomato and we ended up with a vine's worth. We ended up leaving the resort the few evenings we were there to have dinner at the local Bali Collection (worth a visit, great selection of restaurants) It may call itself a family friendly resort but I don't agree - a kids club and kids menu does not make it so. The pool closets to the beach was the one we utilised the most as it was the only one where a little bit of playtime fun and noise was welcomed (and fair enough, other people should be able to enjoy their holidays in quiet enjoyment) and was at times unpleasant - smoking at the swim up bar, at tables while people were eating and around the pool - not so family friendly (imo) - plus the music had all sorts of profanity within it. Personally we won't be back and its not somewhere I'll recommend to friends with children. However, as a couple or a group of adults it is a lovely place to go it is away from the louder parts of Bali.

As posted by many others, the rooms are very tired. Everyone has different standards, but we found the rooms tired, a bit smelly, worn.. The resort has a number of blocks that contain rooms, but to me it felt like a public housing blocks. Most rooms are facing another block so not a lot of privacy on the balconies, which are tiny, barely 2 chairs fit. The first rooms we got were dark and smelly, we asked for another 2 rooms. We got rooms in the last block facing the road, which I preferred as the rooms got a lot of light, and the road didn't bother us. The road is not public, instead the driveway for the resort. The positives, location is great. Walking distance to Bali collection 5-10min, beach access. The pools were fantastic. They are big, and lots of room, you never feel like you are too close to anyone, and the hotel was at full capacity. The grounds are massive and very well managed. The service was great. We only had breakfast included. The choice is big, but the taste of a lot of food was bland.. Still lots of options, so you can always find something to eat. Message to management- the pastries are awful... seriously, get another supplier. We would stay again, but would try and get a suit or something similar as they are much nicer rooms.

Beautiful resort, with lots of amenities and a great location. The staff is very nice, and the food is great. They have different pools and the beach, lots of chair to seat in and toilets all around. The rooms are spacious and have a lot of extras. The reception is just fabulous! I had a great time here.

No idea why this resort has so many good reviews. Far from normal 5 star standards. Toilets at the pool dirty and smelly. Glasses dirty. Different music blaring from two sides. Music has technical issues and stops every few minutes making weird loud noises. Staff unfriendly. Beach full of dirt. Hard to find empty sunbeds that aren‚Äôt fully in the sun. The whole place looks run down and desperately needs renovations.

more variety of food, looks like one cook in 4 places only name of the food has different name. I have a problem to find sometimes find dinner or lunch for myself. Entry and exit to the swimming pools quite difficult. I'm not old but i have problem with my joint . So many old people have a problem to get in in or out from the pools
Perfect in every way. The staff were so friendly, nothing was too much trouble. Amazing spa treatments on offer. Stunning location. And the food yum. Can't wait to return.

Exceptional Family Stay We had an outstanding experience at [Resort Name], our favorite family destination. From check-in to check-out, everything exceeded our expectations. Highlights: - Spacious rooms and bathrooms in the new building, equipped with top-notch facilities. - Extremely helpful and polite staff, always willing to assist. - Multiple pool options, with the bar pool being our favorite. - Pristine beach with comfortable sunbeds. - Fantastic breakfast spread with varied options. - Convenient air-conditioned rooms. - Exceptional barista service, ensuring our specific orders were met. Standout Features: - Impeccable cleanliness and maintenance throughout the resort. - Excellent value for money, considering the prime location and comparable resorts in Nusa Dua. Merusaka remains our top choice for family vacations. The combination of modern facilities, outstanding staff, and beautiful surroundings makes it well worth the price. We highly recommend this resort to anyone seeking a memorable and relaxing
Best hotel I've ever stayed in. Highly recommend. Great breakfast, friendly staff, amazing location and comfy rooms (especially the bed and pillows). Will be retuning for sure.
We loved this hotel, staff, food and room excellent couldn‚Äôt fault it Will stay again

Located at Nusa Dua Beach, excellent hotel with good facilities, buggy service, and big swimming pools. This hotel is big and spacious. However, the rooms are basic, but the hotel services and beach chairs are plentiful and that makes up for the rooms. Although high season, it was worth the stay. Plenty of room during breakfast, beachside beds. The beach however had a lot of dead seaweed/grass and if that bothers you, then it's not a good beach to swim in. Apart from that, everything was great, very close to Bali Collection. Enjoyed my 3 days stay.

Pada akhir bulan september kemarin, saya dan keluarga menginap di Merusaka Nusa dua untuk merayakan ulang tahun istri saya. Pada hari ulang tahun istri saya, pihak hotel memberikan kejutan berupa complimentary cake & sebucket bunga segar yang cantik. Kamar di dekor sangat cantik, dengan ucapan happy birhday, hiasan balon & bunga di kamar serta taburan bunga di bath up kamar mandi. Istri saya sangat menikmati momen tersebut & kami sangat berterima kasih atas surprise yang diberikan oleh pihak hotel Kami sangat puas menginap di Merusaka. Mulai dari kondisi kamar yang baik, kolam renang yang bersih (saya lihat petugas nya rajin membersihkan kolam), staff yang sangat ramah dalam melayani tamu, sarapan yang bervariasi, serta lingkungan kamar yang nyaman & tidak berisik, serta kejutan yang diberikan saat birthday ataupun aniversary, hotel ini sangat pantas mendapatkan rating penilaian 5 dari 5. Hotel ini juga dilengkapi dengan kids club & kolam renang anak jika menginap bersama anak (kids friendly). Jika mau ke Pantai, hotel ini juga memiliki akses langsung ke pantai. LUAR BIASA!!! Secara khusus kami berterima kasih kepada pak Tedy & Pak Dicky yang telah banyak membantu kami selama kami menginap di Merusaka...

Certainly the pick of the bunch along the Nusa Dua Mengiat Beach area. Lovely grounds, great swimming pools, great restaurants/food & lovely people. Food was very nice in all restaurants with a large selection particularly in Gading. Certainly recommend.

The location is lovely, within a secure estate with beautiful surrounds. The grounds of the hotel itself are also beautiful and the sunsets are incredible - but I do have to agree with many other reviews that the hotel itself is definitely not 5 stars, which is fine, but should be adjusted to be more accurate and realistic for those considering it for their stay - and the prices should also be adjusted to align. The buildings are weathered and worn, needing attention. Our deluxe pool side room was dated with old, stained furniture and just needed a deep clean (also see a few reviews stating this and it‚Äôs true). Some of the beach lounges were torn and just look a bit worse for wear. The pools are nice and probably good for kids. The food is pretty good overall, though somewhat limited if eating between the two main restaurants (similar menus). The staff were lovely and seem to navigate all the various clientele as best as possible. The touches just aren‚Äôt there as you may expect for a 5 star, or certainly ones I‚Äôve stayed in previously. Again, this is all fine if you are aware of what you are getting when booking which is why this hotel should probably be considered closer to 3 stars. And unfortunately I truly felt we paid far too much for what it ended up being.

Review of MERUSAKA Resort, Nusa Dua, Bali Having recently stayed at the MERUSAKA Resort in Nusa Dua, Bali, I would like to share my experience and highlight what an excellent destination this is. From check-in to check-out five days later, every aspect of the resort impressed‚Äîfrom the quality of the facilities and accommodation to the variety of restaurants and bars, and the prime location. What truly set the resort apart, however, was the staff. Every member of the team‚Äîwhether at reception, assisting with baggage, housekeeping, or food and beverage service‚Äîwas consistently helpful, professional, and welcoming. It was clear that the staff enjoy their work, which was evident in their positive and engaging interactions with guests. Whatever MERUSAKA is doing in terms of staff management, pay, training, or workplace culture, it is clearly effective and contributes significantly to the overall guest experience. For anyone considering a trip to Bali, I would strongly recommend staying at MERUSAKA Resort. It offers a truly five-star experience in every regard.

Absolutely amazing resort. We had a pleasure of staying in one of the villas at the resort with club access. Loved every minute of our stay, from the warmest of welcomes, smooth and fast check in, golf cart drive up to the villa and the welcome flowers and mini deserts plate, The villa is spacious with a great interior and very comfortable private pool. The cherry on the cake was the 135 meter swimming pool that looked like a tropical river between the two rows of the villas. The overhanging frangipani trees with the fragrant flowers and little garden islands made this feature something special. Buffet breakfast was amazing with plenty of choice and very caring and attentive staff and the settings was overlooking the sea and the beach. The grounds are very clean and neat and the garden beds are immaculately cared for. Yoga classes every morning are priceless. Bike hire is convenient. Afternoon tea, cocktails and set of mini deserts in the villa every evening are the details that made our stay so pleasant. Looking forward to coming back to this resort in the nearest possible future. Jane and Sergey, Melbourne, Australia

Absolutely disappointed with the substandard maintenance. I tripped on an invisible step, twisted my ankle on day one, . I was offered no compensation or discount. Being unable to walk properly or swim made the holiday a huge disappointment.. management blocked off the step so no one else could trip, but would not acknowledge my injuries.
I had a company outing at this hotel, and the staff were amazing, the food also awesome and we really enjoyed our time here
An awesome place to stay with everything on hand to make your holiday that much better. The staff are always helpful and friendly and rooms clean and tidy. We will be gong back for sure!

Off the bat, the reception area is impressive (see video). Beautiful architecture on entry. Location is perfect: beachfront hotel, 10mins walk to Bali Connection to the right of the hotel and 10 mins walk to local shops/supermarket to the left. The grounds are huge and immaculately kept. Beautiful flowers everywhere. Numerous pools to choose from and plenty of beach chairs if beachfront is where you want to be. Many compliments to the staff that put in so much effort to keeping the grounds beautiful. Fitness centre is well stocked with weights and different machines. The only fault I could really pick is with our room (6112). Pool access was THE ABSOLUTE BEST after a long hot day exploring Bali. We used it so much. BUT -- Though the bed is soft, the pillows could use replacing as they were not comfy. We had a sewage smell occasionally coming from our bathroom, the aircon blasts so loud (even on Low setting) and the minibar fridge struggles to keep drinks cold. The room could use a few more hooks to hang clothing and USB charging ports by the bed. In all fairness, I can see how the rooms were once '5-star, luxury' but they could really use a revamp of the small things. Staff/Service: Fantastic! If you ever needed service, there was always someone around to help you and reception was quite helpful. Breakfast buffet was excellent! Lots of food to offer including local Balinese food. Bacon, egg station (of all kinds), noodle station, sausages, sushi, tropical fruits, Indonesian food, bread table and all kinds of desserts/cake. Overall, still happy with our stay because we really utilised the pool access, enjoyed the hotel facilities and the location was central.
We were invited by the hotel for a presentation of the resort and we actually been sent back 5 minutes after arriving, because my husband has a lot english level.

A True Gem in Bali - Exceptional Stay! From the moment we arrived at Merusaka, the experience was nothing short of exceptional. What truly set this resort apart was the extraordinary care and attention given to us when my wife and children fell ill during our stay. The staff was incredibly understanding and supportive, ensuring we had everything we needed to make a swift recovery. The food at the resort was excellent, with a diverse menu catering to all tastes and dietary needs. Every meal was a delight, and the quality of ingredients was top-notch. The friendly and helpful nature of the staff made our dining experiences even more enjoyable.
